text: I visited for the first time while staying at the Mandalay Bay for a work conference.  We liked it so much we ate there four nights in a row, trying new dishes every night.  The food was delicious and I loved the small plates and appetizer options. The drinks,  particularly the fizzes, we're so good. I think we tried them all.  The staff was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere was fun and fresh. A very welcome addition to the restaurants in this hotel.

The other reviews are right. This is a very good place at a reasonable price. We started with the daily chefs special, a garlic bread knot stuffed with roasted garlic and drizzled with garlic oil. Just terrific. I followed with a burger that was just as enjoyable. My wife had the avocado and melon salad with fresh local avocados and tomatoes. She said it was terrific. 

I would definitely recommend giving it a try.

Wow, what a pleasant surprise! Outstanding food and bunnies on the logos! The gastro-pub concept is not exactly new but this one is, so I was worried. Things started off badly when we had to wait almost twenty minutes for a table even though we had a reservation. But in retrospect that was more a sign of the place's popularity than its lack of preparedness. The food and service made up for that and more. They suggest ordering multiple small plates to share. We had shrimp, scallops, flat bread, cauliflower, agnolotti pasta and a wonderful dessert with ice cream and pistachios. Check out the menu online for better descriptions of what we ordered. Everything was absolutely delicious and interesting too. The only critique I can muster is that the flat bread was not quite cooked enough for my taste. My spouse thought it perfect though. Drinks were spot on, as you would hope for a gastro-pub. So overall this is an easy five stars. (The manager stopped by several times to apologize for the wait.)

Sat at the bar on a Friday night before hitting up a show down the hall at House of Blues and this was a great start to our evening. It was a toss up between this and Stripsteak and we picked Libertine expecting a little more variety and a little less sticker shock (not sure the variety part came through but overall I think this was reasonably priced meal FOR THE STRIP - $160 for two people having 4 drinks, appy and mains).

What we had: Scotch Olives (our favorite overall) - the lamb sausage brought in a robust (NOT gamey) flavor and paired perfectly with the acidity of the green olives; Libertine burger (excellent and the cheese, tomato, carmelized onions and sauce were each a stand up quality on their own so bringing it together was an incredible flavor profile. We asked for medium-rare and it came out medium++); scallops (cooked properly in that they were tender and juicy, not at all overdone but we missed the element of a nice pan carmelization. Sauce was non-descript and posting this two days later I can't remember anything about the sauce except it was white sauce); roasted cauliflower (heirloom/tri-colored cauliflower with a nut-based crunchy topping - very satisfying and went well with the scallops); Beverages: in some ways their cocktail menu is really robust but, in the moment, hubby and I struggled to identify anything we wanted to drink; their pitcher drinks are quite impressive looking;  I ordered the Paloma (bottled on site, very kitchy/cute and good but probably would try something else next time); Manhattan (hubby liked it); we needed a "pick me up" drink before going to the concert so we went 'off menu' and ordered two Irish Coffees - these were terrific (whipped cream was made fresh for our order and it was a true mixologist performance putting the drinks together - couldn't have tasted better!!).

Pros: atmosphere is great with the cool lighting and wall decorations to the slightly-retro'd feel of the furnishings (bar stools were really comfy); service (I can only speak to bar service) was well orchestrated across the team and we were well cared for without it being intrusive - they nailed service; Irish Coffee.

Cons: Yes, it's a steep price tag overall ($160) for a gastropub dinner for two but I don't think you can do much better for pricing on the strip when you're getting this type of quality food + atmosphere; burger was over-cooked per our order (we didn't ask them to fix this - the juicy toppings compensated enough for over done meat)

So I tried this place the other night. Charles was our server he was great. I'm starting with the food because that's why i go to restaurants. 

We ordered the ahi tuna cones, Parmesan churros, foie gras pate, green kale salad. 45 days dry age rib eye with bone, charcoal corn, and whiskey bread pudding. Ahi tuna was bomb! Parmesan churros look nice but tasted bland, like not enough cheese or salt. Foie gras pate would have been good but it tasted like they watered down with too much cream, which was no Bueno to me because I love foie gras and barely tasted it.  Kale salad was bomb and I don't like ordering kale salads. (you can guess who made me ordered that) rib eye was on point! And it's not on the menu so you got to ask. Charcoal corn also tasted bomb! The bread pudding though was too dry and bland. They need to work on that. 

They're still new so I would give them another shot. Charles our server was great. The atmosphere or ambiance whatever you want to call it was ok but the music was way too loud, I felt like I had to yell at my girl sometimes to hear me. lol

Ordered a beer & a snack during "happy hour"
The fingerling potatoes with sous vie egg featured undercooked crunchy potatoes (never good) some soggy ham not at all enhanced by the wet egg. Overall not too happy with my happy hour-- which btw did not have any discounted prices 
I'd skip it if looking for haute cuisine at Mandalay Bay

After reading the mainly five star reviews, we decided to give this relatively new restaurant a try. The atmosphere is great and the food was phenomenal. The Libertine Burger was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. The food came relatively quick and the service was awesome (especially our server, Karen). Definitely deserves all the great reviews it currently has.

Not impressed. Typical we don't have to be very good attitude, because there are few repeat costumers. Menu looked great, but! Would not go back. All the beers we liked on their menu they were out of. Bad management and bad service and mediocre food.
I was here this week and horrible service. Took 45 minutes between drinks and when brought to their attention they didn't even care. The food was very bad as well. Go elsewhere!

I've been here several times and I try to eat something different each time. One thing I can say is that service is on point and the food is fantastic, above all, consistent. 

Their cocktails are so good that I ask for their pitchers. Another one that I like to have whenever I'm having dinner with not enough friends to ask for a pitcher is the nostro rosa, it is one of a kind!

I've had the fried egg which is one of my favorites plates. I think it is so rich and creamy that I ask for it every time I go there. I also like the fingerling potatoes with the poached egg and Serrano ham. Another great item is the lamb shank, I think is so juicy and tender and they pair it with great flavors. The waygu beef is one of the most outstanding dishes they have. I asked it rare and was BEAUTIFULLY cooked! It is so hard to find someone who execute it like they do. I also enjoy the combination of flavors their flatbreads have, one of my faves is the fennel and sausage. If you feel like having fish, their branzino is fantastic, it is so flavorful and even they cook it on the grill is juicy and tender. 

Desserts are really good too! My go to is the whiskey pudding, I can't get enough of it.
This place is amazing!  The small dishes are big enough to be a full meal, the service is fantastic, and the atmosphere is super hip! I loved he octopus and the crab dip!

Wow! What a wonderful experience! My wife and I decided to eat at Libertine Social for a fancy dinner date while in Vegas. We started out with drinks and the cheese board. The Cable Car cocktail had the perfect mix of cinnamon and sugar on the rim. The cheese board had three distinct cheeses; one goat, one sheep, and one cow's milk cheese. We then decided to split the braised short ribs, brussel sprouts, and truffle mashed potatoes. This was the perfect amount of food for us. I can't recommend their truffle mashed potatoes enough! So good! The service was amazing too! Our waiter was very nice and checked in on us the right amount of times! Atmosphere is on point and looks like a great place to just get drinks for an evening. We would definitely come again!

For our last big meal celebrating Christmas in Las Vegas we dined at Libertine Social in the Mandalay Bay Hotel.  This is a beautifully decorated small restaurant. I didn't choose it and when I looked at the menu there wasn't much I felt like ordering.  So we ordered the menu; all of it.

All the dishes were best-of-breed.  The best hummus dish ever tasted (by all six of us), spare ribs, crab dip, foie gras (of course), strip steak, filet mignon, branzino, octopus -- all beautifully served with emphasis on presentation and unique flavors.  Our server Dorian was super-attentive and understood well how each dish was prepared.  At the conclusion of the meal, we asked to meet the chef and he received a round of applause.  

Great food, great ambience; all six of us loved it.  Highly recommended.

As Euripides said "When a man's stomach is full it makes no difference whether he is rich or poor." Win or lose at the Vegas casinos, you'll be very happy you ended up here. We recommend this place. Ask for the Chef's Table. The hostess mentioned that few people request it, which is a shame. Our favorite dishes were the Oxtail Crostini, Broccoli, Scallops, and Skirt Steak. At the Chef's Table we saw a lot of the food coming out and we begged (successfully) for a pretzel right out of the oven. Our waiter was Christopher who was excellent and gave us honest advice throughout. They also have a fantastic sommelier named Coltin Short who we enjoyed talking to and who provided excellent recommendations in our price range. Really had fun here.

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  I had the pea salad and shrimp with polenta.  My companion had a salad with Thai spice ribs.  The ribs were amazing.  I love shrimp, and they were good.  But the ribs were better.  The service was very good. We had tickets to see One in an hour and we really appreciated how fast they got us in and out.

Libertine Social is a fancy gastropub that is a great place to catch up with friends. Though it is a little pricey for a gastropub, the food is pretty tasty. 

The House Baked Pretzel was baked perfectly, allowing the dough to be light and soft. The cheddar fondue was the right amount of gooey-ness and was a delicious dip to the pretzel. The Wood Grilled Sausages were a good sampler of different types of sausages, which were all grilled to perfection, giving the sausages a smokey kick.

The Black Truffle Pizza had a good ratio of fontina and Parmesan, giving it a nice cheesy and stringy consistency, which is always nice to have with your pizza. The pizza was topped with slivers of truffles, which accentuated the delicious flavors of the cheese. But my personal favorite was the Fennel and Sausage flatbread. The flatbread was thing and crispy, while the sausage was very flavorful and had the right amount of saltiness that was noticeable with the notes of honey that was on the flatbread. 

If you have friends coming into town, Libertine Social is a great place to have some food and drinks while catching up.

The food was amazing! I like the ambience of the restaurant! Modern style. The service was great! The restaurant have a 2 bar, arcade bar was really cool! They also have photo booth. They have patio with the view from the pool side. Most try on small plate is strawberry gazpacho, modern egg. The libertine burger is a bomb! Skirt steak is mouth watering, The sausage comes with 3 kind really awesome! Summer corn was delicious! And last the dessert, hot chocolate martini was fantastic! I will coming for more!!! 5 star!!!

Hmm. How to explain my experience? We came here for my gf's birthday and first of all, it's called Libertine Social, but I'm not sure why. As I glanced around the decor for more clues, everything just jumped out at me as being completely random. No theme, just had love, beaches, photos, cars, all seemingly thrown together without much thought. They even had random bunnies everywhere which were cute, but pretty random. Or maybe because of the playboy bunny? But the bunnies looked too cute! Maybe the Stay Wild sign? But the rest seemed so tame! The lighting was nice, but the tables were plain.

We were also a group of six and they sat us at a table meant for 4, and the restaurant was not bustling. It was just a little confusing. All of our place mats touched each other's so there was zero spacing in between anyone. They didn't think this through? You're seating 6 people for a birthday dinner and you squish us in a little table! Luckily they were fast at clearing the courses from our table, because we could only fit 1-2 dishes at a time and even then it was a tight fit. Our drinks were also perched precariously at the edge of the table because of the lack of space. And this was with only 2 people drinking! The rest of the space was taken up with water.

Luckily, most of the food was tasty and nicely presented. I wouldn't recommend any of the vegetable dishes though. Those were too salty. The ahi cones and oxtail crostini were the tastiest dishes, albeit pricey. They were very awesome about adding an extra cone to the ahi dish to make it a 6 person dish instead of 5. That was very nice of them to do that with no extra charge. They were so cute and delicious!

Service was great and fast! They brought out a birthday dish for my friend, and even though they charged for it (I find charging for a birthday dessert tacky since most give it for free) they at least priced it at a discount.

P. S. The bathroom is freaking gigantic!

Oh yeah, and make sure you take a picture with the bunny angel outside!

Maybe with a few kinks fixed, this place could be better!

During our six night stay at the Mandalay Bay my wife and I had three of our dinners at the bar at Libertine Social. The bartenders are friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu. We shared small plates at each of our dinners. The hamachi cones and Thai spare ribs were our favorites, but the gnudi was also terrific.

The restaurant's energy and feel are really nice - somewhat energetic, but not loud. You can have a conversation at the bar (at least on week nights, anyway, it looked like they had DJ on Friday).

The beer selection is very good and they have some really nice "draft" cocktails. Did I mention the hamachi cones? Mmmm.

Food quality was good. Wait staff failed to order party member entrée and one side dish. Excuse was we were his first table of evening. Very slow service or failure of staff to deliver completed dishes.

Fiancé and I went here for appetizers to celebrate our engagement. We had the spicy tuna cones, the braised oxtail crostini, beef tartare and the porchetta. The beef tartare tasted mustard, wasn't too crazy about that one. We weren't crazy about the cocktail menu, so we just went with dirty martinis. Mine tasted like they added sweet vermouth or something orange flavored. Kinda weird, but hey, I'm not one to complain with a martini. I ordered a second one and asked they did not add vermouth and the server said they don't add vermouth. Idk what tasted so weird with the first one. Service started kinda slow, but once it got going, everything was great and the wait staff didn't leave a dirty plate on the table for more than 2 seconds. They were very attentive. Would definitely come back to try other items. The three other apps we had, besides the tartare, were all must orders. I'm still salivating over the tuna cones.

I was in town on business and a customer of mine is vegan I yelped vegan on yelp and this place sowed up to my delight it served a variety of dishes some that had meat I enjoyed my meal my customer was that lived in town never heard of this place said it was his new place to go.

I wanted to give this place 5 stars but this James Beard award winner came up short. We told the server that we had a show 1.5 hours from the time we sat yet we saw delays every step of the way. Overall food was on point: hamachi, beef tartare, hummus, branzino, chicken, filet were well prepared. Skip the kale salad. Had to send it back because it had wilted and yellowing leaves, over compensated with too much dressing. Excellent atmosphere.

I was looking for a place to have some quick bites and drinks while at the Mandalay and Libertine looked like the perfect spot.  I wasn't looking for a long sit down dinner so I we just sat at the bar and ordered.

The mixologists here are very friendly and fast.  They have an extensive mixed drink menu and drinks are nice and strong.  We passed the time waiting for our food playing a funny card game with the bartender and before we knew it our food was there. 

We started with the tuna cones which were awesome.  They were perfect little savory bites and good for sharing.  The house baked pretzel was also surprisingly good with a very addictive cheddar fondue. 

The grilled octopus looked absolutely amazing but by some freak accident my water ended up spiling on the plate!  Without hesitation the server took the plate away and brought me back a new dish - awesome service.  It was worth the wait as the octopus was delicious.

Overall, the food and drinks here are great and very reasonably priced relative to the other restaurants at the Mandalay.  If you are looking for a good casual meal with drinks then definitely stop by Libertine.

I would say 4 stars is a little generous. Everything sounded great but my lamb shank was severely under seasoned, and celery root puree was also bland (as one might expect), so the combo was poor. Pomegranate seeds added little as did the sauce. Was recommended by server - hope that was a just her mistake and other dishes are better.

What an amazing find here! Libertine offers so many varieties of liquor and cocktails; creative, fresh, seasonal salads; and incredibly delicious entrees. We got the pea and prosciutto salad with goat cheese ravioli, BBQ carrots, truffle mashed potatoes (must),  bone-in short rib, wagyu flat iron. Everything was delicious, and the service was impeccable attentive without being pretentious. 

The table next to us had ordered 3 desserts that made my heart and tummy swoon, but we ordered way too much delicious food that we couldn't spare another square inch of our tummies. Highly recommend this restaurant for libation and good hearty eats.

Reservations recommended, but walk in hours just before 7pm seemed to be just fine on a busy weekend with multiple large events in Vegas. This restaurant is also Open Table friendly. Get those points!!

I can not comment on the food, as I was only here for drinks.  What I will say is that their drinks are pricey but strong.  I had the margarita and one of their signature bottled cocktails.  They also had local beer on tap.  This is a good spot to sit at and people watch.
Excellent service! The BEST Lemon drop Martinis and the most AMAZING Hot Soft Pretzel dip  I've EVER had!! A must have!

Hands Down an AMAZING restaurant! The vibe is great - you can go semi casual or dressed up. There is a great lounge area by the bar, tables throughout the restaurant, or you can sit right up in the action and watch the chefs create their masterpieces. I HIGHLY recommend the "caviar fried egg" - total game changer! Also, for the seafood lovers, spiny tuna cones are bomb. Mine and my husbands steak were cooked to absolute perfection by chef CJ. Oh, and do yourself a favor and order the lobster ravioli - you wont regret it. A staple for us during Vegas trips.

Loved this place-John-Bartender extradionair! Jake and Jordan-manage this place beautifully. Serving staff on point. Tony Abou Ganim really hit it out of the park with this place!  Food and drinks crafted to perfection!

Great spot! 

I ate here on a Tuesday night and this place was so back that we had to try and find a spot at the bar. We ended up sitting at the bar in the Arcade Bar. The food was delicious, my favorites were the burger (one of my all time favorites), the corn, the broccoli. I need to come back to try the rest of the menu. 

The staff was knowledgeable, friendly and on point! We were served by an awesome bartender, I wish I could remember his name! The decor was creative and fun, the Arcade bar menu is a work of art. This is an awesome place. 

I will definitely be back!

For a restaurant only being open a week and a half you would expect flaws. Well this was not the case with this wonderful restaurant.  Four of us dined. The cocktail menu is exceptional.  We tried three of their specialty cocktails.:southside,zigzag,and a bardstown sling. All of them were great. Then we went to small plates and experienced the modern fried egg, the ahi tuna cones,the melted farmhouse cheese(pretzels and melted cheese were fabulous),the kale salad, the summer corn agnolotti, and the caramelized fennel and sausage flatbread. One dish was better than the last. I couldn't even tell you my favorite because they were all fantastic. We then had the branzino, harissa rubbed mussels,and flat iron. We all shared and experience all the larger dishes too. The branzino might have been the best prepared fish I have had in a long time. We finished our meal with hot chocolate martini and the margarita donuts.  Oh wow. This restaurant could not possibly improve from who wonderful it was. A must go.

What a great experience!!  The manager was amazing.   We went to see Michael Jackson's one.   We came on a busy night and the manager went out of his way to take care of us.  We did the beer dinner.    It was a amazing.  The food was breathtaking!!! We had bay scallops with a persimmon sauce that melted in your mouth.  Everything was top notch.  I will be there Again.

Super fab.  I've only been once, but pretty much everything was delicious.  Standouts were the pretzel (though they really should serve 3 pretzels rather than 2, because you end up with all this yummy raclette left over and nothing to put it on, and then there's the awkward moment when you try to figure out if you know the person you're with well enough to eat a spoonful of melted cheese on its own in front of them or not....), the baked goat cheese (yes, I like cheese), the roasted cauliflower, and the whiskey bread pudding (and carbs, I know, so much for resolutions).  The sunsplash cocktail was terrific, a little tart, a little sweet, a little too easy to drink quickly....  The service was excellent, they were clearly slammed, but that didn't impact the attention paid to our table.  Well done.

Amazing food and service. Everything is family style so great with big or small groups. Also great so you can try a lot of different things. 

The patio overlooking the pool is was lovely and the decor is sleek.

The summer corn agnolotti and wagyu skirt steak were exceptional but everything we had we very good. Staff were very attentive and glasses were never empty. Will for sure be coming back.

This has become one of our favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  We are locals, and huge foodies.  The "Caviar Egg" should not be missed.  I don't think we've ever had a bad meal here, and we have gone at least 1/2 dozen times!  Highly recommend!

3 Five Star reviews for this classic establishment made me want to check it out. 

We got there at 10:30 and know that they closed at 11:00. Regardless, the hostess was happy to receive us and brought us to the dining area. Our server Kawyn came over and offered us sparkling or still. Everything seemed pretty normal until I asked him what was popular there since the items on the menu had items I was not familiar with. Kawyn really took his time going through sections of the menu describing items from food prep, appearance, temperature and taste. Having come from the server industry myself, I really appreciated that he took the time to do this after we ordered our cocktails. The rest of the serving and bussing staff was nice and professional. When our dessert was accidentally ordered out early as we were still on our entree, the server said that he would bring it back to the kitchen and bring us out another one when we are ready for it. Plate setting was nice with classy heavy duty looking place mat and utensil were still looking brand new. 

My orange vodka sunsplash was very well done with simple garnishes and my girlfriend was please that her lemondrop was "the best that she has ever had!" 
Grilled Kale Salad tasted great and came in a good portion size for sharing between two with enough to take home. 
Braised Ox Tail Crostini had just the right crunchyness to it and was cut to a good portion size for neat and classic dining. (I wish it was 4 pieces instead of 3)
Our Manhattan Style Bread Pudding was done just right and did not have an overwhelming amount of whiskey taste to it. 

A lot of other items went out to other tables that looked very appealing. I will be back. 

Bathrooms had bright yellow retro looking doors that really popped. There was also a photo booth on the way to the bathroom where you can take pictures. Great idea, sadly it couldn't print our picture yesterday. Wide open space and design on wall was tasteful. 

If you like your spirits they have an exclusive spirit bar housing rare spirits that you would not find at your local bevmo.

Staff were friendly and helpful. However, the food is not so special. Premium prices for an less than average meal. Maybe I was expecting too much as I ordered the Wagyu Rib Eye. Disappointed!

Wagyu Prime Rib was my order. My friend had the Short Rib, also disappointing. Definitely an off night at the restaurant.

It is a rare joy to be able to be at opening night for a new, novel, restaurant so I am happy to report on the first night for Libertine Social. Sadly someone beat me to first place before we even sat down :( jk jk

Libertine Social is located in the restaurant row of Mandalay Bay next to Aureole and across from Kumi. Colonel Klink read about it and we headed over after drinks in Eye Candy. 

Room is huge, "this is a gymnasium" said the Sprossling, and the walls are covered with interesting objet d'art. The waiters have a rabbit pin on their ties, and there was some story about a guy and his living room, but I'm not sure we caught it (could be on us for we had some cocktails beforehand). I would like to know more about the concept. Maybe on the menu? Edited to add correction by the Colonel that he heard the whole story so I guess only I was drunk.

We were seated and immediately looked over the drinks. Colonel Klink got one of the adorable bottled drinks, ZigZag, which was pink and had a chunk of watermelon sticking up. I tasted but am not a good judge as it was following a Manhattan I brought with me; but he was pleased and the presentation was adorable. The Colonel meanwhile got a Margarita with mezcal, and was happy. The margarita was served 'long drink' fashion, an FYI for the purists out there. 

I regret to report I did not get our waiter's name but he was friendly and attentive throughout, as was all of the service. The Sprossling was wowed at how his Pepsi sugar bottle was whisked away the moment it was empty. The Sprossling agrees with the first commenter, looking around at one point and saying, "the service is ON POINT." 

I collected the desired order and we had, as a table: 

Belgian fries with aioli -- very good sauce
Coal charred Irish corn -- my favorite of the night for unusual flavor
Chilled grilled prawns -- firm, tasty, a tad salty
Sausage board -- not sure I got all of them, I think merguez was best
Shaved ham flatbread -- pineapple was a bit too present in sauce, threw off balance but it was a far better thing than the original 'devil's pizza' as that particular combo is referred to in our house. 
Ahi tuna in tiny cones -- adorable and tasty, have I seen before?
Crab dip -- I feel like spinach could be chopped finer, and blended better, the crab really only came to the fore after it had been mixed up by eaters at the table, also maybe serve hot? ETA not being sarcastic here, we are thinking the shallow ramekins may have let it cool down super quickly....

Finally we had for dessert margarita donuts -- a tad salty -- and the other winner of the night the Negroni, a panna cotta with Campari gel and plums, truly novel and tastebud entertaining. I enjoyed that with an espresso and a lemon twist teleported to me upon request by the seamless service.

Despite the very small quibbles everyone left happy and agreed that we could theoretically eat there every night for the rest of our stay!
This place has the best drinks and it's hard to get a table . If your lucky enough to get reservations try their pretzel bread and cheese . Moscow mules are prefect !

First of all, special thanks to Melissa, she  pleasantly greeted us before taking us to our website table. From there, Andrea, was very informative regarding the menu. Her recommendation of the chicken was a great call! That has to be one of the dishes I ever had! Also, had the side of potatoes and the Scallops, the serving was better than most. Great dinning experience, highly recommend, and then I'd definitely come back! Just be prepared to spend some monies!

I was very skeptical at first since restaurants in hotels on the strip can be very hit or miss. I seriously could not believe the amazing food and service I received here! There was a slight miscommunication with my order that really wasn't a big issue for me, but when the manager was notified (I believe her name was Jordan), she immediately came over to my table and took care of the issue. One of my best experiences ever at a restaurant thanks to Jordan.
Amazing atmosphere and bar staff, horrible waiter and overpriced food...coming from a local

This spot is happening! Amazing ambiance,  craft cocktails, and really cool innovative cuisine.  The bartenders are super fun and friendly,  and it's nice and inviting.  Some of the cocktails are pre made,  which is kindof weird to me. Not a huge fan of pre mixed, but the menu is so extensive that I can see why there would be also something like this on the menu too. Nice spot for a light bite and a drink,  or a nice dinner with friends.

My fiancée decided to take advantage of my ADHD and had me play that, My Vegas Rewards game, on my phone.  Most of the prizes were hot garbage, but there was a 2 for 1 coupon for this place.  I was skeptical, but It turned out to be an amazing experience.  The pork chop just melts away in yo mouf, and the service is incredible.  My father is a chef and I watch Anthony Bourdain a lot, so I know a good meal, and this was a top 10 meal.  Next time I go, I want to ring the dinner bell, though.  They should raffle that off as a MLife experience.

First off..... You must sit at the bar or lounge area! It is way more interesting than the dining area, but to each it's own. I obviously sat at the bar and my only complaint would be that there weren't any hooks for me to hang my purse, but there were hooks on the pub tables near by? Bartender told me that will be added soon. (It's the little things I tell ya). I was able to interact with all three bartenders and they know their shit! I noticed they carry my favorite rum Zaya and Jose suggested that I start with that. He mixed up a mean classic daiquiri and it was AMAZING!!!

Food!!!! Jose pointed out his favorites and told us that everything was good. So we chose a couple that he suggested and a couple that caught our eye. Let me tell you.... He wasn't lying... Everything was good!!!

Skirt steak- I'm sure it doesn't say it on the menu, but it's accompanied with a chimichuri sauce!!! 

Corn- roasted and whipped with an Irish butter!!

Wilted spinach flatbread- if you like burrata... You'll love this. 

Parmesan churros- has a different taste than I expected, but it was amazing

Warm crab dip- actually had large pieces of crab (no small, maybe it's crab, maybe it's not pieces)

Chocolate martini- it's desert inspired by cocktails! It's rich and yummy

I need to come back for that skirt steak!!!!!

Sat at the bar and had a great experience. I had the Pretzel and the burger. Both were great but the burger was phenomenal! I want to explain it in further detail but this food coma isn't letting me. 

Additionally, the atmosphere the 3 bartenders created was fun. You could tell they really enjoyed working there. 

Pricey but worth it.

Very very very cool atmosphere. Good drinks but the prices are very stiff. I ordered some food with the drinks and it was "meh" at best. Come for the fun and drinks, and have a small snack. The interaction with the bar and other tables is what makes the place.

Very expensive food, we spend $154 before tip for two people, but we did order 3 alcoholic beverages.  We had the crab spinach dip which was phenomenal. We ordered a shrimp cocktail and lobster ravioli which were both pretty good as well. I do warn you, that if you're starving, this is not the place that will fully satisfy you. We are not used to leaving a restaurant hungry, but the portions were fairly small for the average eater. Otherwise, great service and fun, modern and artsy environment.

Came here with a girlfriend one night during our Vegas weekend, recommend making reservations as anyone who did not have was being seated in he bar area.
We had drinks at the bar before sitting down, cocktail list was extensive and had some great options. The interior decor was very cool and we were seated directly across from the kitchen which is always a good spot
For food we ordered Tuna tartar tacos (5stars) crab dip (5stars) sausage and fennel flatbread (4 stars) Brussels sprouts (3stars) and the scallop entree (4stars). It was a good amount of food, probably could have skipped one dish but don't regret it!
Recommending to anyone in Vegas for the weekend, such great vibes, food, and worth the price!

We went because we had a coupon. I asked our waiter which of the rib plates he recommended. He suggested the $36 short rib over the $18 spare rib because the short rib was much better, came with a side and another side of tomatoes. Not 2 minutes after ordering, another table had spare ribs delivered and it was a pretty sizable amount of ribs. I assumed my meal would be huge. It arrived in a very large fancy dutch oven and when they opened the lid for me I had a hard time laughing. I asked the person where the rest of my meal was. They said that was it. I tried it and it was terrible. I left hungry. My wife ordered the sausage plate and literally got 3 slices of sausage and a couple of items of a few other things. She too left hungry. My waiter said he was going to ask his manager if he could do something for us as we were clearly not happy. He never spoke to the manager. We spend $80 on bad food and walked away hungry. Our $40 drinks were the only thing we loved about the place and the only reason I am giving them 2 stars.
Hands down the best restaurant in Mandalay Bay!! Great service and amazing food!! I will be back 100%.

Tried this place for the first time last night and I am not sure how I feel about this place. It was a slow night for them, there were only a few tables when we arrived around 7pm. We were greeted and sat  immediately, hostess was very friendly and sweet. Love the decoration of the restaurant, very modern, chic, variety of decor around the wall, very cool place to sit and have some drinks. Our server was great, very friendly, made drinks and food recommendations, came back to check up on us several time, service was on point, drinks were always re-filled, no problem with service at all. 

Now the food...they have a few interesting items, our server told us that we ordered all their signature items which are also their most popular ones. We were informed that their menu is meant to be family style so we shared everything:

Marinated Tuna Cones -  average item, very bland, not much flavors, not worth the price. 

Modern Fried Egg was very interesting to try, very small portion for $12 per egg; warm egg yolk on the bottom, corn pudding, then caviar on top served with brioche. This was the most interesting item on the menu, was not sure what I was eating at first, overall tasty but not completely satisfying. 

Braised Oxtail Crostini - the most flavorful appetizer, topped with onions, slices of radish, the sauce as very flavorful, good item to try.

Foie Gras Mousse - light foie gras flavor, topped with some kind of sweet jelly like "sauce," served with slices of pear and crostini. The mouse was very smooth and creamy, not too fatty in flavors to where you get sick of it. We did ask for more crostini since the jar of mouse was pretty big for just 3 slices of crostini. 

Salt Roasted Beets - similar to other beets salad - delicious but not much different from beet salads from other places. 

Sausage board - 3 different types of sausage served with pickled peppers and sauerkraut, nothing special here either. 

Lastly we ordered their special for the night, which was Wagu steak with stroganoff sauce on top served with shitaki mushroom. This dish was delicious, the meat was tender and flavorful, cooked perfectly! 

Overall, I enjoyed the dinner but was not crazy impressed. For the price of some of the items, the food should be more impressive. I have had tastier and more interesting food at the same price point, none of items stood out to me and make me go "WOW." Having said that, service was awesome, the restaurant is pretty, they have a nice drink menu. If you decide to come here, definitely try the Modern Fried Egg, very interesting item.
The food was mediocre, nothing that special for the price.  The service was so slow and they added gratuity on a party of only 6.

Probably had the best service ever from Dutchy.  He recommended the Ribeye... amazing... He recommended the Foie Gras ... the best I've ever had.  He also said the modern fried egg was something one should experience in this lifetime and man oh man he wasn't kidding.  The corn pudding and caviar combination was the bomb!  We'll be back and will be sure to tell everyone we know that this place rocks!  The entire staff was extra friendly and that's something I look for when going out for dinner.  My glass was never empty, that's a plus in my book.

The photo booth was fun, but our picture didn't print.. thank goodness for social media, because it showed up on Facebook and we loved it.  Thanks Libertine Social for a fun experience ... My favorite drink was the Green Swizzle. We couldn't get enough of it.  yeah it was Yum.  Oh and we ended up taking one last recommendation which was the Manhattan dessert, a bread pudding with loads of flavor including the ice cream swirled with maraschino cherries and vermouth.  WOW We left speechless

Food is prepared in many creative, sophisticated way, though the overall result taste was just okay, not really worth their effort nor price. Still enjoyable though. Our waiter was very helpful and informative about these innovative dishes. Nice place dine.

Fun spot for a snack, the menu and relaxed atmosphere mean it's more of a bar-with-food place rather than a full-on restaurant.

Mushroom pizza is pretty good, appetizer sized for two or three. Drink menu, like most Vegas places, is a bit generic but has good breadth.

Zero reason to get excited about it, but if you need a more casual option in Mandalay Bay, it's acceptable.

Good burger, relaxed spot for dinner. Good parking. Ha. See photo. 
What else should I say to make this "official review" length? It's Vegas baby, everything feels a bit fake to me here, but the burger and fries was legit. 
.
.
.

OK I tried it again, and thanks to my review I remembered to avoid the sausage board. So this time I went for the fish tacos. And I'm not really a huge grilled fish taco fan. But I really enjoy these tacos. They had an amazing taste, the grilling was done just perfect, the sauces in store bought tortillas Were pretty good. And I most definitely come back again to get some of these tacos.

Great service and food. Very new and fresh drinks.  The waiter was very attentive, I would recommend the rib eye very tasty. Libertine g and t drink is a gin drink. Asparagus with egg and prosciutto was good too

I'm sure the food is excellent but we'll never know because the hostesses treated us like garbage. They played around with our table and sat people who arrived after us before us. We're presently at another restaurant not far away being treated like guests should be. Guests always have other choices and you only have one chance to make a first impression.

Love the decor and set up for the bar area upon entry. We enjoyed drinks here one night with a large group. The servers were awesome. All about fun. The drinks were typical. But the ambiance and vibe was upbeat and exciting!

Meh, maybe this is a better place drinks or maybe I just didn't order the right things but wasn't a huge fan of the food. Came for a late meal and ordered the Brussels sprouts salad and mussels. The first few bites of the salad were good but it didn't really stand out. I wouldn't order it again. The mussels were good especially with the sauce but my last few mussels (about 3 out of 15) were bad mussels. I had to spit them out discreetly. Maybe it was my fault for ordering shellfish so late but they should have inspected the mussels more carefully or not offer them after certain

Food was ok, prices were high and portion sizes were extremely small.  We ordered a round of appetizers, not small plates, and ended up ordering a second round because of the sizes.  It was a fun, social environment but not sure I would return to eat.

Cheap expensive to-go food. 
This place looks more promising than the food court. I was hoping for quality healthy quick to-go food. 
What I got was below quality for double the amount paid. I didn't mind paying $10 for a hearty wrap and another $9 for a panini. My husbands chicken kale wrap was all mostly kale and dressing. My veggie panini was the size of a sandwich and mostly bread.   There were no pesto or any flavoring added. I ordered a side of fries which tastes dry. Not a place a recommend for a quick bite.

The food was amazing! Atmosphere was fabulous, and our waiter (Dutchy) was on point!!! His recommendations were great and we loved the food and wine he suggested. We will definitely be returning next time we are in Vegas!
We waited 35 minutes to receive our drinks, and we ordered crab dip with toast-it tasted like tuna casserole.  Not impressed at all.

Not a great experience this evening at Libertine.  The attention was clearly on the Mertel event and not on the customers in the dining room which was half empty.  Waited more than an hour for entrees.  Typically when my wife and I pay $155 for a meal we get more than 6 minutes to eat mains before having to leave to make our show.  The food was fine and the waiter apologized multiple times.  Might suggest calling ahead to make sure there is not an event going on before booking here.  Had we not had a reservation and felt obligated to honor it we probably would have avoided the situation altogether.
Food is exceptional.  Wait staff are awesome chef is great. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas

LOVED this place. I've been twice for dinner and once for lunch. (They have a pick-up side window with a small but amazing menu for lunch)

The food is creative, and tastes great. The plating is like a work of art. The service has been on point every time I have visited. 

I loved the game you can play in the bar area. (If you are sitting in the dining room area you might not know about this) There are cards at each table that have dares on them. You use them to be social with other players in the bar area. ( hence the name Libertine SOCIAL) It's a fun way to meet new people. 

My boss was recently in town.  (he owns the salon at MB) I referred him to Libertine and he and his Fiancé LOVED this place as well. They loved the food, service, and were impressed with the fun drink menu as well. 

A welcome addition to Mandalay Bay!

Great spot, we (a group of 2 couples) stopped by for a quick bite/dinner and a drink before a show. We were actually starving and knew we were short on time to eat. We informed our server of the circumstance with our timing, she was awesome and the whole experience/food at Libertine Social was perfect and went smoothly.

We ordered the beet salad, skirt steak, octopus, and asparagus. All of the dishes were fantastic and easy to share.  We especially loved the skirt steak.

I would definitely go back.

YUM!   The chicken, partly fried was to die for. It came with potatoes but they were hard to locate on the plate as they were smeared across a large area.  The wilted spinach flat bread with burrata was amazing.   The service was great.  Martinis are way to small for the $17 you pay.
Flat out impressive. Drinks, steak, roasted cauliflower, all done well and seasoned to perfection.

If you happen to find yourself at Mandalay, you should stop by Libertine to grab a bite to eat. Or, a drink at the bar if you're waiting for an event! 

This is currently my favorite place to eat, drink, and hangout at Mandalay! I just realized that I love gastropubs and will be adding Libertine to the list.

The food menu changes because they are farm to table (which I appreciate and love) so if you're a yelper like me scrolling through photos, you won't find dishes that are the same because it depends on what is in season.

We sat at the bar and ordered: 

oysters (West Coast) - a must try, sweet and delicious 
beet salad - refreshing
fried olives - to die for!

Service was impeccable. Everyone we encountered was smiling and kind.  The bartenders are so friendly and happy! It's contagious. For me, this speaks volumes about the establishment and how they treat their employees.  

I absolutely love the decor, ambience, and the fact that there's an open kitchen area where you can sit and watch the professionals in action. The back of the restaurant features a wall of glass overlooking the Mandalay Beach. 

There's only one bathroom each for men and women but the rooms are huge. You can fit like 20 people in there. Seriously! But only one toilet, haha.

Nick, the general manager stopped by to say hello and was so gracious as to comp a couple of drinks for us before our Bash at the Beach concert at the Mandalay Beach (thanks to my friend, Ashley, for the connection). Unfortunately, we had to decline because we both were not drinking that night but we were very gracious of the kind offer.

I would definitely recommend this spot. Reminds me a lot of the type of establishments you'd find in NYC. Great food, strong drink menu, and service as it should be. 

An A+ gastropub in my eyes and 5 stars !

Came to catch dinner here before hitting up Michael Jackson and it was pretty good! The atmosphere is nice, chill and not smokey. The waitstaff is awesome and very attentive to things like  finished plates and 2/3's empty water glasses :) I would come eat here again. The food was out of the ordinary, yet everything cooked perfectly!

We are always excited to try a new restaurant that boasts creative menu items and farm to table quality.  The three of us had a marvelous meal of small bites, and particularly enjoyed the caviar egg dish and scotch olives.  The service was superb - attentive, friendly, helpful with selecting items from the menu and just all around pleasant.  Dorian was our main waiter and he took such good care of us I will request his section when we return.  My only negative comment and reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the noise factor - acoustics were challenging.

ok let me start out by saying this place is cool as hell. They bottle their own mixed drinks and the three that my husband and I tried were all on point. They have a deck of truth or date cards on the bar which makes the environment relaxed and gives you a living room feel- the menu was pretty unique and a lot of the items looked like they were going to be great coming from the kitchen to the tables and bar seats around us. The only reason I have to give this place 4 stars instead of five is because the king crab strawberry gazpacho was horrid, I mean like... kin to vomit. It was beautifully served, little whip of avocado paste on top slice of king crab was thick and impressive and then came the strawberry liquid.- now I love strawberries but something went horribly wrong there. Other than that, the staff was friendly and inviting, the appearance of the place is clean, creative & comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this place if you're in Vegas and will definitely go back! (just don't order the gazpacho!)

Stopped by for dinner and my only regret is that I didn't find this place sooner! They are not messing around when it comes to the food, everything we tried was delicious. The drinks and service were also excellent. I will definitely be visiting again.

Looked like a very cool place to eat but there are kinks in service. Takes way too long for food to come out!  Scallops were good but it needs some veggie or starch because it was a "big" plate. I expected a full meal. Same with steak. The whole plate was piled high with meat. It was alright not quite worth the $65 price. I didn't order any veggies on the side cause price seemed too high for just veggies. You would think it would be less if they were sourced locally. 
Mussels were good but most of the flat breads were burnt on the bottom. Grilled bread was also burnt.
Service was super fast, and the quality was so good. They have items that are not on the menu, so look at photos on yelp. The libertine burger was amazing and off menu.

Three coworkers and I made a reservation at Libertine Social this week during a business trip to Las Vegas.  We decided to do a family style dinner, so we could try multiple items.  The restaurant is lively, bright and fun; the service was great and the food was amazing.  We shared the garlic hummus with veggies and pita, the beet salad, the grilled shrimp and polenta, the broccoli, the cauliflower, the fennel and sausage flatbread, the whole branzino and a Manhattan and strawberry rhubarb crumble for dessert.  It truly is hard to pick my favorite dishes as everything was so tasty, but I will dream about that strawberry rhubarb crumble...seriously delicious!

Really excellent menu and service. Creative menu items and awesome presentation - try the Foie Gras small plate for a visual and gastronomic feast. Drink menu is V inspired. If you like Gin, try the Aviator Cocktail. It'll have you buzzin'! Never really busy because of the location, but rezzies are probably recommended.

If you can get past the fact that it's in the Mandalay Bay, this is a highly recommended resto!
Great food! Recommend the Thai ribs and the kale salad. Beautiful restaurant and a nice experience overall. Honestly, some of the best ribs and salad I've had in a long time.

The beef tartare and clams were amazing!  Grilled scallops and the lobster ravioli were cooked perfectly . And with the manager Jordan found out it was our anniversary, they comped us a desert of our choice and recommended a great dessert wine. I will be back again.

I was so excited to try this place, I had a myVEGAS reward B1G1 entree. When we got there the place was pretty empty could be because they had just opened for dinner. The staff was friendly and attentive. The prices were high but a given, it's vegas! I don't mind paying extra for quality but sadly even with this coupon it hurt me to pay. We ordered the pretzel and cheese sauce plate appetizer $18 wow SALT! Now I know pretzels normally have large granules of salt over top but this pretzel seemed to be saturated in salt but not only was the pretzel salty so was the cheese sauce. My husband and I were so hungry & don't like to send food back so  we ate most of it and washed it down with water. Their menu is somewhat limited compared to many restaurants. We decided to order the burger as we had seen it on some list online of top vegas burgers. When the food arrived it looked and smelled delicious!! We took one bite and to our great disappointment it too was salty. Idk if the chef/person who made our burger cant taste food anymore or is a long term smoker but we were so bummed. I could tell the burger had good flavors and was quality but the salt  we didn't finish our burgers and were so over the place we just wanted to leave. When our waiter came I was expecting him to say something about us not finishing our food or ask how it was but he didn't. When the bill came it was about $80 (already deducting $20 burger and my husband had a cocktail) we paid and left and sadly will not be returning.

Dined 3/31/18

Definitely recommend paying this restaurant a visit! A very interesting selection of food and an even more delicious and creative cocktail menu! Roderick was our server and had the best recommendations for us and was also extremely kind and hospitable. I work in the hotel industry myself, and he went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was nothing less than perfect. We live in New York City, but already can't wait for our next trip to Vegas and Libertine Social is the first restaurant on our list! Thanks again for the amazing service and hospitality!

Ate dinner Saturday the 4th after not eating for a day, just too busy. I ordered beet salad and steak med well. I got beet salad and a steak rare with nooooo server in site for 15 minutes, I ate the red steak mostly cause I was very hungry. Today is exactly five days later. The toilet runs started right after the awful stomach cramping less than one hour after the meal. Then the headache... We paid $100 for two, with one perfect meal and one horrible case of food poisoning that I am still having toilet runs. I have attempted three times to contact the restaurant and have emailed the hotel three times and ALL unsuccessful in reaching someone that gives a care. Skip this place too hit and miss, too pricy to screw up food handling and certainly lacking in follow up.

So excited to visit this amazing restaurant and bar on their first week! Loved the bar vibe and cool decor. The food and drinks were all amazing. Great shareable snacks for enjoying w one of Tony's delicious cocktails! Sit at the bar for all the mixology action! Can't wait to go back.

This place was a blast. Fun atmosphere, great people watching, fast service & delicious food. Right on restaurant row, the comfy lounge-like seating in the bar area makes it great for people watching. In addition to several cocktails, including the Zig zag, We had the tuna cones, scallops, shrimp w/polenta and pasta. All were fantastic. We also ordered the Brussel sprout salad which was good, but a little too bacon-lard & raw Brussel sprout tasting made it one dish we didn't finish. All in all, looking forward to going back & trying the rest of the menu.

We had dinner at Libertine Social last night and it was honestly the best meal I (we've all) had in a long time. We tried basically every appetizer on the menu and every single one was amazing and full of flavor. The Caviar Fried Eggs were so rich and delicious, we couldn't stop talking about them. We also tried the pretzel, truffle pizza, foie gras, spicy tuna...all delicious. The chicken entree was a huge hit, as were the scallops and side of truffled mashed potatoes. Chef Jamaal came out to say hello and was so welcoming and friendly, just like the rest of the staff. The service was top notch from start to finish. We will absolutely come back the next time we visit Vegas!
Incredible cocktails and service at the bar. It reminds me of yesteryear when service and professionalism truly made the Barman the aristocrat of the working class!

Great food, great service, and weather-permitting, great patio dining.  The menu items are creative, but also really well-prepared.  And they also make special items for our daughter, who is not interested in adventurous dining.  Great small-ish plates, we've had the soft pretzel, hummus and cauliflower, and something else that was good, but over-shadowed by how amazing the barbeque carrots are.  Get the lemon meringue pie, even if you don't think we want dessert, it's so good.  Staff are super friendly and very professional.  This is the kind of place we visit multiple times in one weekend.

Very great overall service!  Somewhat cramped feel but did not affect my dining experience.  Waitress (Cham--?) was very friendly, engaging, and had a great personality and attitude.  Menu items are incredibly unique, my favorite being the octopus.  A bit on the pricey side, but average for what you expect in Las Vegas.  If this type of food is out of your range, it may be best to stick to the food courts at Mandalay Bay and MGM Grand.  The atmosphere is very casual and laid back.  Unfortunately did not order drinks, but seeing them walk around deliver to other tables did make them look good.  Play the date cards on the table at your own risk.  Some of them are a bit extreme but they definitely add fun to the table while waiting periods occur.

This place was exceptional. We wanted a place to have dinner that had a sexy but chill ambiance and great food and Libertine Social delivered. We had the cheese board which was generous and served with grilled country bread and grilled grapes. I was full after that but we had wagyu skirt steak with grilled pardon peppers and a grilled corn dish coming and it was so good we ate it all. I kept saying it was one of my favorite dinners in Vegas ever. It was 10 ounces and it melted in your mouth and it was the perfect amount for us to share. The corn dish was spectacular. They surprised us with dessert for our anniversary- a Black and Tan pudding with caramel corn. Delisciouz!

Everything was impeccable! From service, to cocktails, to food, and the ambiance, everything was onfuckingpoint. As we entered, we were greeted by their host. We were offered to sit at the bar while waiting for our table. The bartender greeted us and we ordered our first round of drinks. They had televisions everywhere in their lounge area. It was interesting that they had a set of cards at every table at the lounge. It was almost like a truth or dare type of game where you pull a card and have someone from your group perform the task. Every card has a designated letter and whoever completes the word "LIBERTINE" wins. They also have a photo booth room in the back near the restrooms.

What we ordered:

Warm Dungeness Crab Dip 3/5
Braised Oxtail Crostini 5/5

I fell short on taking notes of the drinks as we tried so much and I did not keep track of all of them but I did remember that the Bardstown Sling and the Southside were the favorites that evening.

This place was amazing. The GM Nick hospitality was next level. The service was attentive without being over bearing and the exec chef Jamal is crazy good at his job. The hummus appetizer was incredible. I know, hummus. Somehow, they turn it into a creamy masterpiece. We had the farm salad- fresh with great flavor, skirt steak with chimichurri, and the branzino. The Brandi o cooked with the skin on over a mesquite grill was the best I've ever had. Most everything is cooled over a fresh mesquite grill, as Jamal is from Texas, which keeps it healthy. No big sauces or anything to distract from the flavor of the meat or fish. Finished the meal with a snifter of 100 yr grand mariner. An amazing feast that I will definitely revisit when I come back to Vegas.
This place rocks!!! Try their burgers! Its juicy, well made and taste like grass-fed Kobe beef. The service is fantastic and the prices are fair.

We got here early for dinner so we went to the bar,  we were completely ignored three times by the cocktail waitress before she took our drink order.  When we got our drinks they were $35.00 for minimal amounts. 
We were seated and then ignored yet again in a tiny area by the wine area. Rx Broiler is a much better atmosphere with computable prices and much better service.  #lasvegasstrong

If you're looking for an upscale restaurant that doesn't isn't a celebrity chefs restaurant, this is a good place to check out. The appetizers and salads were by far the best part of the meal. 

I especially loved the beet salad. The beets were a yellow variety that they were very tender and subtle. The pork belly was one of the best I have ever had. 

The reason I'm giving this restaurant four stars is for two reasons:

1) The entrées came out cold. Unfortunately we did not have time to have them re-fire it because we were trying to catch a show. They were very favorable and I'm not sure why they would have left the kitchen cold. 

2) Our server Karen seemed to take her time with everything (maybe this is why the steaks came or cold). She was very knowledgeable about menu and drink selections, but speed was not here forte. 

I loved the atmosphere and selections and I'm sure I'll try it again.

Came here after hanging out at the pool all day and wanted something better than the pool cafe grub.. 

Parched? Try the...
Apple Cobbler Cocktail - gin, Apple cider juice, ginger syrup, cucumber/lemon juices - so refreshing 
Pirate Punch - rum based tropical delight. My hubby loved this so much he had 2-3 of these!
Boulevardier -will kick your a$&! 

Food sound good?
Ahi tuna cones - phenomenal to me. I don't know why but just like eating a spicy ahi roll with the little tempura flakes on top, having ahi (but non spicy) in a pastry like cone is just a whole other level of awesome.

Black truffle pizza - I love truffles. This is spendy because there are actual slices of black truffle instead of a traditional topping like pepperoni but it's good. These pizzas are definitely Jen sized which means they're personal sized which means you'll probably be hungry if you eat this alone but it's still worth trying if you love truffles as much as I do.

The short rib crostini app - flavorful and good! Perfect for sharing between 2 people!

Burger with fries - we were drinking so this seemed really good but we had it after being buzzed so not sure if it knocked our socks off (or I guess flip flops off) or it was indeed really good. You be the judge. 

Friendly staff, great food. Definitely a must if you're wanting some apps and drinks, which is basically all the time in Vegas I'm learning.

This is the place to be !!!
Generously poured drinks , tasty food, friendly service. 
I will absolutely will go back.

My wife and I checked out a lot of options for dinner and we're extremely happy with our choice of Libertine Social. It was fairly empty which was nice as it allowed the extremely attentive staff to pay even more attention to me and my lovely lady. I ordered a Manhattan and it was done just right. My wife ordered one of the specialty cocktails that comes in a bottle. It was delish (according to her). We decided to order a few small plates and boy did we choose wisely.

We started with the Hamachi Cones, which were out of this world. Spicy, tasty and unique. Next was the warm crab dip that had large chunks of crab meat and tasty bread that served as the vessel. We then moved on to the brussel sprouts and Choucrette. It was incredible. My wife didn't love the Choucrette but well, she was wrong. :) 

With tax and tip and two drinks and four small plates the total was $130. As for the staff, everyone was incredible. I would definitely recommend this place for a great place for a date.
It was ok. May be I ordered the wrong drink. But I wasnt immpressed with my cosmo. It tasted like lemon water. But people were super nice.

If you are looking for a fancy burger and fries, this is your place. Had the burger and fry combo with a stout on nitro - great combination. Fantastic service. Can't wait to go back and try something new next time!

This place might be the BEST thing that ever happened to Mandalay Bay and maybe even Vegas! Super cool vibe and atmosphere. I usually like trying new restaurants and not returning to the same ones while traveling.....but this place.....we visited 4 times in the week I was in Vegas and loved it every. single. time. Ate once in the restaurant and the other times sat in the lounge. The farm to table style food is AMAZING and prices are reasonable. We tried the strawberry gazpacho and "fried" egg apps which were out of this world, great chicken and flatbreads, and the oysters - o.m.g - the best! Shawn at the bar is amazing - super fun and personable - he made it feel like we were at our neighborhood bar chatting with friends. Don't pass up a fun time and great food at this place.

My first time to have dinner with this restaurant. Foods and drinks is very nice and the presentation look so good and also test really good too. The restaurant is so big in Mandalay Bay Resort and they're have table indoor and outdoor. 
About service is nice and foods come fast.

I have to say that when we (my boyfriend & I) sat down at 7pm on a busy Friday night with a show at House of Blues that we needed to get to, I was a tad concerned about getting lost in the shuffle of this bustling bar and eatery...but after the initial hurdle of tracking down menus, the service was A++! While waiting for food is of course going to happen on a busy evening, the waitstaff was friendly and highly efficient when it came to everything else, from water to ordering and right down to getting the check. Despite my initial worry, we never once felt "lost" or ignored.

Food was AHH-mazing! The short ribs (with Thai seasoning; also worth noting that this "small plate" had at least five pieces of flavorful meat), BBQ carrots (unexpected knockout!), and American prosciutto board (perfect balance of savory and sweet cured meat with cornbread and maple butter) came together to be an haute spin on American classics--great for right before our country concert! We admittedly did not try cocktails because we were planning on imbibing later in the evening, but that's now another reason to go back to Libertine Social :)

Ambience/decor was trendy without being stuffy or unwelcoming. Dare I say it was tastefully cozy? And the "dare" cards on the table make for a fun distraction while waiting for food.

Only downside is the priciness, but as a Vegas local I can say that's to be expected when dining on the Strip.

Service was top notch. Best of all everything was free since it was a hosted event from NetSmart for our company while attending the AHCA convention. Loved the decor and the vibe. Food was served in a heavy pupu (appetizer) style. We had Cajun Shrimp Cocktail, Black Truffle Flatbread, Steak Skewers, Avocado Crab Salad, Parmesan Infused Churros and Caviar (wasn't a fan). We had a few other things but totally drawing a blank. This place was really good and it's a great place to socialize and network. I even got to catch the Broncos game. Bummers they lost though. Those who had drinks enjoyed them as well.
Great bar. Kind of a hidden gem. The Manhattan was amazing! The burger was straight up legit! Bar staff was fun to talk to.

I thought everything was fantastic.  The food was incredible, the drinks were strong and remarkably tasty, and the feeling at the restaurant was just very upbeat and lively.  To begin we had wine and a bourbon based pre made cocktail. I really liked the ingenuity of the cocktail where you're given a bottle instead of having to wait for the crafting each time. We then had the tuna cones, mushroom flatbread, and the brussel sprout salad. The ahi cones had a nice kick with the sauce and the presentation was awesome. The flatbread had more of a pizza feel than your typical flatbread which I enjoyed tremendously. The brussel spirit salad was a nice side with whole pieces of bacon and apple rather than sprinkled as per usual. I like this heartier rendition better. The ambiance of the bar is really nice and the staff were great. I really wish I had a casual bar like this closer to my house on the west side. Prices are very high so it's not a weekly dining venue, but I highly recommend trying it out if you're looking for a new cocktail bar with amazing food on the strip.

So glad my cousin took us here for dinner. The food was great! The Petaluma chicken, the libertine burger and caramelized fennel sausage flatbread...all are a must try. We look forward to coming back here. Our server Benjamin was awesome and very friendly. The manager Jake was great to. A must try in Vegas!!!

They are still new, so they may still be going through some growing pains, however there is not much here that warrants your attention. We tried several of their small bite options as these are usually more flavorful than the entrees, thus we can't really comment on the larger entrees. However, with the exception of the braised oxtail crostini, everything seemed a bit off. We wanted to try the duck pastrami and the coal charred corn, but alas they were not there the evening we dined here.

The braised oxtail crostini was the most flavorful bite of the evening. The oxtail was braised well and had the luxurious feel of collagen that you get from oxtail. There were some pickled onions on top which added a nice sweet and tart note to the dish. Overall, it was the most successful dish of the night, with the exception that the bread upon which it was served was very bland and lacking any character.

The warm Dungeness crab dip sounded good, but alas it was lacking in crab flavor and a bit fishier than we are used to. Good Dungeness crab should be delicate and sweet. It was creamy as expected, but the flavors were overwhelmed by the spinach. Perhaps, a little less spinach (as in none) would have allowed you to taste the Dungeness crab, which really should have been the star of the show. Again, the toast chips that came with the dish were underwhelming and bland, so we ended up just skipping the toast chips.

My wife was excited about the caramelized fennel and sausage flatbread, however again, there was something lacking in the execution. Fennel sausage is usually very good, but here it was lacking in flavor. In addition, the camembert that was on the flatbread tasted almost like goat cheese and overwhelmed the sausage, so that you end up tasting more cheese flavor than the fennel sausage. Given the overwhelming cheese flavor, the dish would have been better served if it was paired with more sweet notes, such as the addition of caramelized onions or even an onion jam.

Of the dishes I was looking forward to the most was the house made soft pretzel. I have a special place in my heart for home made soft pretzels and baking fresh pretzels at home fills the place with the warm flavors of butter and yeast. Given all this, I was especially disappointed with the soft pretzels. It had a good crisp exterior with some crystals of salt, however the inside had no flavor whatsoever. There wasn't any of the warm presence of yeasted dough. This was made more evident by the raclette fondue, as it is a more pungent cheese thus overwhelming the flavorless soft pretzel.

The salt roasted beets were also disappointing, especially given that roasted beets are usually so full of flavor and sweetness. The main problem here is the salt roasting process. While it might work for whole fish, with its protective layer of skin, salt roasting beets end up saturating the beets with salt, almost to the point that it is inedible. Perhaps, the beets would have been better served if they were rinsed before serving. The only bright note in this dish was the appearance of oranges which really helped to offset the overly salted beets with some needed brightness and sweetness.

Given the lackluster dinner, we decided to skip out on dessert, instead heading over to Sweets Raku to try them out.

All in all, the food looks good here, but there were many missteps in execution that should make you wary and try some of the other more seasoned places around town.
Came for a private party, the our d' oeuvres were delicious and I became a fan of the little spicy  tuna cones !

The service and food are amazing. Karen and Colton took great care of our party two nights in a row. 

We ordered several dishes to share at our table and each was better then the last.  

We enjoyed desert in the private bar area and were treated to desert spirits and scrumcious bread pudding. 

Our experience was the highlight of our busy work week in Vegas.

One of my favorite restaurants I've ever been to, hands down. The service was absolutely phenomenal. The server had great menu knowledge and gave excellent recommendations. The Wagyu skirt steak was cooked to perfection. The crème fraîche was an amazing touch to the tuna cones, and the manhattan bead pudding made for a perfect desert! They have a revolutionary concept and atmosphere, and an extraordinary food and cocktail menu. I will definitely be returning!

Good food, great ambiance!! I came here with a large group on a Monday night. The drinks were delicious and the food was great. The beet salad, spicy tuna cones and the branzino were all delicious! I wouldn't say this is the best restaurant in Vegas but definitely a fun place to go to with friends :)

I was really expecting a better meal given all of the great reviews. My wife and I had lunch here before heading to the airport. The decor is very funky and, like the other restaurants in this place, they spent a lot of money on furnishings. 

We grabbed a booth in the main restaurant area and perused the menus. Not a huge lunch menu but the burger sounded good. After ordering some beers, our food arrived. The plate was quite warm which was great for the burger but my side salad did not belong on a hot plate. The salad was basically lettuce but it was decent enough. Eating something green in Las Vegas should count for bonus points. The burger was pretty small for $20. The bun was tasty but was so soft that it basically collapsed in my hand. It was greasy, too. The beef and toppings were pretty tasty but really nothing noteworthy. We split an order of fries with garlic aioli. I was expecting a large plate with a light sauce, but we got was a very small plate of fries with a small cup of ketchup and a small cup of the aioli dip. Decent enough, but nothing great.

I walked out kind of disappointed. Not my idea of great value for an $80 lunch. Meh.....

We came here for the Super Bowl. The advertisement said $55 for all you could eat buffet. The buffet consisted of pizza and sausage plus a few other things like ( e. g. house made soft pretzel). We should have gone to Kumi right across the way. It would have been much better.
We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here before catching the Michael Jackson show. The Thai ribs were very good, the drinks were good, and everyone in our group enjoyed their food.

While the black truffle pizza was delicious. The black truffles didn't taste or smell like real truffles. Good cosmo though

Update: kudos to the manager for paying attention to his reviews. He brought the bag of truffles out while I was still sitting at my table. He explained the truffles come from different regions at different times. I still stand by the fact the truffles didn't taste or smell like anything at all. And I've had a lot of truffles in my life. I hope the chef tries them and discusses with their supplier.  gold star for the attentive manager

It's not the best picture but it shows you how delicious the braised short rib was! 12 of us went to dinner here while attending the Licensing Expo. We had an issue with the hostess' not allowing us to add ONE more person to our reservation .. we asked everyday for 5 days and the answer was always no. I showed up early the night of our reservation to ask one last time ... well guess what .. the table was set for 12. The number we needed all along so it clearly wasn't an issue so I'm not sure why they said no all along. Anyway, food was great, service was good. Braised short ribs, crab dip, fried olives, and sausage flatbread are a must try!

Very  cool atmosphere our waiter Eric was friendly but not very attentive. We waited a half an hour before we even got our salad, and then another half an hour for the main course it was a Saturday night in Vegas , but this restaurant was not completely full. We had asked the waiter where our food was , his comment was yeah I've been telling the chefs, he never came by our table to say anything. The food was delicious but I would never go back again waiting an hour to eat is just ridiculous

Stopped at Libertine Social to check out the hype prior to a concert with my significant other.  

ATMOSPHERE: 
Fun, upscale, hip and spacious. Definitely a date night kinda spot, I love how spacious the restaurant is, you can go with a large group of friends and not feel cramped. We sat at the bar to catch a game.

FOOD:
Very nice menu for my epicurious people out there! So much variety and unique dishes on the menu, I know I'd like to return to try different dishes. Had the crab dip, which was delish not too overpowering but still flavorful. Spinach flatbread was cooked perfectly, but I wasn't blown away with the flavor, and got fries  (can't go wrong there) with a killer garlic aioli. I was most impressed with the presentation of the dishes here, nothing was over the top but it also caught my eye, they walk the fine line just right. And now the cocktails, the margarita was definitely too sweet, but I didn't mind, the lemon drop was perfect I could smell the lemon zest even when the drink wasn't near me quite aromatic. Probably the best lemon drop I've had made by a bartender. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 
Nice staff, friendly, and attentive for sure. The bartenders were great giving me directions on how to find the events center and were just great bartenders period. 

Overall I recommend going here, but since we have SO MANY trendy culinary spots in Vegas I wouldn't say this should be at the top of your list... just dont leave it off!

Libertine was a great meeting spot for my friends and I last Friday night.  Our group of seven sat over-looking the walkway of restaurant row and people-watched while sipping some delicious cocktails.  We weren't that hungry, but did split up and tried a bite of the burger, fries and pretzel with cheese fondue.  All completely YUMMY and I was kind of bummed that we weren't available to fully indulge in dinner.  The service was delightful and I can't wait to go back on my next visit.  Definitely a hip, casual place within Mandalay Bay.  And I LOVE the rabbit/antler painting outside the restaurant!

The only thing good about our experience here was the sweet girl who bussed our table!  We waited 35 min for our first (and only) cocktail, which we got only because we flagged down a manager.  After another 15 minute wait we still had not seen a waitress and ended up giving our appetizer order to our busser.  A runner brought our apps and we still had not seen a server.  When the busser cleared our app plates we had to ask again for a server to place our order.  Dinner finally came and was incredibly disappointing!  Portions looked like they were from the children's menu!  $318 for 4 dinners, 2 apps, 2 beers & 2 cocktails...and we saw a server once.
