We called for a manager before we left to share our experience and he was completely indifferent and unapologetic.  I would have had better service and better food at the local buffet!  You'll have better luck on the penny slots than this place!

Went here on valentine's day because the menu looked so good! The staff was super friendly and the hostess sat us at a table on the patio. The heat lights outside were perfect for a semi-chilly evening. We shared the tuna cones which were so adorable, and also delicious with a hint of spice. The half chicken entree was perfectly cooked, I cannot emphasize "perfectly" enough and the truffle mash potatoes that came with it were extremely flavorful and truffley. I almost regret not sitting inside because the couches and decor was cute. It's a fun restaurant and I recommend it :)

Wow! Wow! Wow!  The food here is delicious!!!!  The drinks are absolutely amazing.! It's an amazing ambience for a nice conversation with a friendly conversation or business discussion.  The bartender Justin guided us through an incredible night and the food runner Armando explained every dish.  I love a place like this.  I guarantee you won't be disappointed. Do it!!!!

Burger was the best I've ever had!! Also, the crab dip was pretty amazing too. Service was really good until it got busy...then service slacked a bit. IMO...this is the best place to eat at in Mandalay Bay. Reservations are recommended.

My husband and I came in here for a quick bite before going in the Michael Jackson One show that he surprised me with for our anniversary. 

We came in right when it opened so it wasn't busy. Pretty comfortable, modern, ambience. I eat pretty much vegan style so I asked the waitress about vegan options. She recommended the hummus platter & also they can alter anything on the menu to make it vegan like eliminating any cheese or dairy in a dish etc. 

I ended up ordering the broccoli appetizer & hummus platter which tasted really good. My husband got the pretzel without cheese but they still put out a side of cheese just in case lol We also ordered a flat bread with tomato sauce, mushrooms & olives & potato dish. We got the hummus platter & pretzel & got full so fast. Between the two of us, we are lightweight consumers.

It was taking quite awhile to get the other dishes so luckily as we were waiting, my husband brought a lil medical mj chocolate bar from the dispensary the other day to hold him off. While we waited, we ended up getting full. The restaurant started filling up & our view of the basketball game that was blocked. 

 The waitress finally came out & said that the potato dish we ordered comes with butter & asked if he still wanted it & we were like no thank you. She should have asked us that when she took our order but at the same time we were actually relieved because we were already full. I asked about the other dish & she said it was coming out soon. 

Everything was pretty good there. The service was just a bit slow but maybe she was having a bad day or because it looked like business was starting to pick up.

Despite the slow service, I would come back again because everything was pretty flavorful.

To start out with, our bartender on Saturday night was Jose and he was really great.  Super personality and very helpful.  My wife and I decided to stop in for small plates and drinks since we felt like going lighter before the evening got going.

My wife got one of the fizzes(Milano) and I ordered a glass of Pinot Gris which were fine.  The small plates we ordered where the Cheese Board and the Prosciutto Board.  The Cheese board was what we considered to be about average but the Prosciutto Board was an odd combination because it had a maple butter, a syrup on the meat and cornbread with it and the combination just didn't work at all.  Too much sweet and not enough to balance it out.    

Jose had said that they just changed that dish and it used to have a grilled bread as a side which would have been a better pairing.  

We somewhat enjoyed the vibe and layout of the place as well.  All in all, it was a new experience and we would need to try some different food options in order to rate it higher.

Best steak ever.  Had the wagu strip. Was fabulous dessert was the chocolate marti- GREAT
Try the stuffed olives for a starter.

Libertines put value on physical pleasures, meaning those experienced through the senses. I actually had to look up what Libertine means with the help of Wikipedia, LoL. I had an awesome time socializing with a group of friends at this Hipster/Modern/Rustic/Artsy gastropub restaraunt that is getting alot of attention lately. I mean you have a James Beard Awardee, Chef Shawn McClain and Modern Mixologist Tony Abou-Ganim. From the moment you walk-in to the delicious meal is simply outstanding. We had a group of great servers who were attentive and friendly. Special shoutout to Quinn, Mercy and Nestor for the awesome service. Pretty much everything that was recommended for our party was on point!

DRINKS(cocktails)
-Pyrat Punch- Delicious drink composed of Rum, Fresh Lime, Pineapple&Orange Juices, Nutmeg, Curaçao & Angostura bitters.
-Zig Zag

SMALL PLATES:
-Smoked Shrimp Cocktail
-Spare Ribs
-Spicy Tuna Cones
-Creamy Garlic Hummus
BOARDS:
-Beef Tartare
SALADS:
-Avocado Panzanella
MESQUITE FIRE GRILL:
-Whole Roasted Branzino, it had an olive & vinaigrette, grilled lemon flavor. Really good and the fish was cook just right. ~~Favorite for our group~~
LARGER PLATES:
-20oz Bone-In Ribeye w/ grilled onion and salsa verde ~~Favorite for our group~~ tender and full of flavor
-Lobster Ravioli ~~Favorite of our group, fresh and the sauce was mouthwatering went well with our white wine.~~
SIDE PLATES:
-Whipped Yukon Gold Potatoes ~~Consistent and delicious with kick of spices, took this ordinary side dish to the next level!!
-Barbecued Carrots

DESSERTS:
-Strawberry Rhubarb Crumble w/vanilla ice cream
-"Black & Tan" Pudding (Chocolate and butterscotch w/spice whip cream and caramel corn)
-Margarita Donuts (Lime curd filling, tequila glaze)
-Manhatten (Rye whiskey bread pudding w/vanilla maraschino cherry ice cream) ~~~Outshine the other desserts that we tried, delicious and left us wanting more!!!

We had a delicious meal and nothing was not worth trying out. However, we agreed that the Margarita Donuts was too much for our palate. The tart was overbearing other than that, everything was really good and would definitely come back for more.

2017 Yelp Review #35

This place is the epitome of hipster. Do they say that anymore? "Hipster"? Very cool decor. Vey loud though. I wouldn't suggest this place for an intimate or quiet dinner with a group where everyone needs to participate in conversation. 

The menu is funky and they had some amazing options. I'm mostly vegan but they didn't have many vegan options- of course- I could alter recipes if I wanted but I just didn't want another plain salad or hummus.  We did order the hummus for an appetizer and it was good. But I had hummus the night before. 

I opted to go off the map and I ordered the Branzino filet with caper vinegarette. It's fish. Yes I know.  I'm not a true vegan. Whatever. The fish was ah-may-zing!!!  The flavor in the skin and the buttery meat was Delish. I ordered a side of asparagus with it (less the ham and egg garnish). I didn't need it. The fish was plentiful and flavorful. (I even thought about not reviewing and posting because I ordered fish for the fear of ridicule.) 

My coworkers ordered the braised short rib (both) and they raved about the dish and the portion size. 

I'm giving 4 stars for the noise level and for the timing of the meal. We hadn't even finished our appetizer (maybe 1/3 of it) and our entrees came out. So needless to say, we didn't finish the appetizer and they picked it up uneaten.  Service was great other than that!

First time and would go back!!!

I shared the spare ribs, hamachi cones, and the fennel sausage flat bread. 
The ribs were nice and tender + full of flavor. 
The Hamachi did not taste very fresh which was disappointing 
But the flat bread...oh my!!  So sooo good!!!! 


I drank the Paloma which is a tequila based cocktail and it was super good

This review is for the Restaurant Week 2017 menu

My last stop for the two weeks of RW was at Libertine Social and it was a good choice.  I ordered:

Caviar fried egg
House made cavatelli pasta
Black and tan pudding

The caviar fried egg was a small appetizer but luscious!  The salt of the caviar mixed with the egg white foam and the whipped yolk was an amazing combination.  Following this came the house made cavatelli pasta with fava beans, mint, crushed tomatoes and parmesan.  Very tasty and filling pasta.

For dessert, the "Black and Tan" pudding was made of Dutch chocolate and butterscotch pudding and served with salted caramel corn.  The combination of salt with the pudding was excellent.

The restaurant is quite noisy.  I was seated in the back which shielded me from some of the Happy Hour crowd of conventioneers but the whole place has a very vibrant atmosphere.

My server, Karen B was excellent.  She gave advice when I asked about a choice of which I was unsure and she was right on all the time.

A good find through Restaurant Week and I'll be back to try some of the other dishes that I didn't get.

Decor...all over the place.  Road signs, check.  VW camper van at the beach, check.  Guitars on the wall, check.  No thought at all...just full on "Hey!  Let's be eclectic!!!".  
As for the food, that's where stars start to really fall.  Again, "Let's be eclectic!!!", seems to be the motif.  I can hear the setting the menu... "Ribs!  Ox tail! ...oh, and how about a pretzel!".  
Take a pass, or settle on a weak, small expensive truffle  pizza, then go find someplace for dinner.
Had the best dinner here for my mom's birthday. Fabulous food & service. Thank you Dorian for your impeccable service.

Excellent service! Went here during happy hour yesterday and was blown away by the food and service! We tried the stuffed olives, ceviche cones and duck cigar off the Happy Hour menu and was seriously impressed! While at the bar I noticed it looked like they had Patrone on tap and was asking the bar tender about this. He indicated it was their house Margarita mix but went on to explain how their mixologist tastes every Patrone from multiple types of barrels to pick the best one. They actually have their own Libertine 100% agave Patrone tequila barrel! Bartender (wish I'd gotten his name to give him props) was fantastic! Even let us sample the tequila! Well done Libertine!
Stopped in to have a few drinks and sit in their very comfortable seating area. I was server was very attentive and I will definitely go back to have dinner there.

After 2 visits, I am firmly entrenched in my infatuation with Libertine Social.  This place is my new crush. I've got a fever and the only prescription is more Spicy Tuna cones and scotch olives.  Food can transport you and evoke so many memories. If you grew up in the South on that government cheese, then you are probably familiar with a chuck wagon patty.  That is what these scotch olives reminded me of in the very best way. My sister and I bit into one and were instantly transported to our childhood. 

It wasn't until my second trip that I worked up the nerve  to try the truffle pizza. As a general rule, I find truffles overpowering and somewhat unpleasant. Until I tried this pizza. I. Am. Still. Speechless.  The pizza perfectly balances the egg, truffles and crust which add up to a perfect flavor combination. You must try this pizza.

Libertine Social is an A+ across the board. I plan on being a repeat customer.

Went here for our 20th Anniversary dinner! Charlie was our waiter and he was fantastic. My husband ordered the Waygu steak and truffle mashed potatoes and I got the Branzino and asparagus and everything was delicious They even brought us a complimentary dessert for our special occasion.

This place is located inside Mandalay Bay. I came for lunch and tried a flatbread pizza for around $16. Interior decoration and vibe here deserves 5 stars (but food a 3). Everything is very modern and trendy. Their cutlery were not your average silver color. They were a bronze-brown ish color. They had Persian rugs on the floor and super cool looking light-fixtures. Waitresses wear Crocs heels and food service is a bit slow. The fennel sausage pizza tasted just ok. The toppings were completely great and up my alley but the bread itself was chewy and dry. I didn't get their cocktails but would come back again for them because they looked really tasty (check out their fizzles and social swizzles menu!).

Each dish with one exception was flawless. The hummus appetizer was exceptional. The oysters not so much. The off menu salmon was exceptional. The bar pizza with wilted spinach and Burrata cheese may be one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life.  It was like eating a tasty cloud. Not all Burrata is equal. I'd like to know who their supplier is.  Stopped in for drinks and food before the Dave Chappelle show. No pictures as no phone allowed at the show. It was on my list. It was better than I expected. Great vibe.

We were looking for a place to grab a somewhat lighter dinner before seeing Michael Jackson ONE, and we were intrigued by the ambiance and menu at Libertine. We shared the gnochhi in parmesan broth with mushrooms - they were light, fluffy, and unctuous! We also shared two orders of the crispy octopus salad (see photo). The octopus was perfectly cooked and charred and the accompaniments were Mediterranean in nature: eggplant, a puree, greens. Paired with a nice chardonnay, it was the perfect mean before going to the show. Ambiance is modern yet comfortable. Service was attentive and quick, but our server was very matter-of-fact, as if he really did not want to be doing this job and was forcing a smile. His manner was...pithy. That was the only downside
I liked it but high prices for portion sizes.  Some of the sauces were not great. Sugarcane is a better option at the Venetian.

One of the better lunch options near the Mandalay Bay conference center to be sure. Small but nice lunch menu. Favorites when I was there today were the grilled shrimp, broccoli side, and tomato soup. 

Service was pretty solid, and the ambience is very nice. I really like the vibe. It's also a much larger place than it looks like from the outside.

Would not recommend this restaurant. I had a reservation and when we got there they were closed. Majority of the time the restaurant is dead. Beware they close at 10pm. There are multiple  different sources that say they are open later. This is a location that is redeemable thru the myvegas points. Probably for a reason. They are hurting for business.

Been there 3 times.  It is confirmed, WOW!  The unique small plates and cocktails complimented by some of the best bartenders in Vegas it is a must go to.  Ask for Shawn, aka Collin McGregor, he will show you how a old school bartender acts.  Classisc style!
Amazing place. Great atmosphere, large variety of foods for every taste and amazing service. We also enjoyed drinks form their menu. We will definitely come back when we are back to Las Vegas!

What a great find - superb food served by super nice staff who are very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food and drink they serve ! 
This place is a great new addition to the stale restaurant row at the Mandalay Bay - and it was found all thanks to great yelpers who all seem to agree - this is the new place in Vegas !

Came here for a nightcap after a so-so dinner earlier. Ordered a Moody Tongue Chocolate Churro Baltic Porter from the great, eclectic beer list which was very enjoyable. Food wise, everything on the menu looked tempting but we settled on the chopped ham flatbread (think high end Hawaiian) and finished with the Manhattan bread pudding which was very decadent. Will be back again next time in Vegas and we'll definitely be trying other Shawn McClain restaurants

People here are very kind for starters never let our glass get half empty, and did it with a smile. Atmosphere is great open with a modern vintage Las Vegas feel. Social interactions are in couraged, so it made it fun since it was a party of 5. If you are a cheese fan like me the melted farm house is a must very unique balance of mixed dip sauce with pretzel. The chicken here is amazing and fresh!!!!! Not over fried but crunchy enough to enjoy. I highly recommend this place nice place. Gabe our host was awesome and got our food out fast couldn't have gone better.

Ordered a "Turkey Avocado Wrap" for $15 and I have to say it's the grossest wrap I've had. It was mayonnaise soup and had MAYBE a sliver of avocado. Not worth a darned penny if you ask me, the bagged chips were the best thing I got sad to say.

We stayed at The Mandalay Bay for a cheer competition which ended up being my 50th Birthday as well.  We were only able to get one nice dinner in the entire weekend, so I chose this place. I had looked at other reviews and pictures and all I knew was that I wanted one of their yummy cocktails with the fried green olives I definitely was not disappointed with either. We also order the hot crab dip & a cheese board for appetizers. Everything came out fresh and hot. 

We also Oder the Brussels salad with bacon, and the potato fingerlings...amazing!!! We paired it with the skirt steak & the fillet sea bass.  The sea bass was so good and flavorful.

I was to full to try the desserts. I will definitely go back next time for some good food and cocktails.

Dorian our server gave us OUTSTANDING service & took great care of me & my girls. He made our dinner extremely enjoyable with his impeccable service, thank you. Come to this restaurant if your in Vegas located in Mandalay Bay. They're food is nothing less than tasty! from the refreshing salad, ahi tuna cones, main courses, & delicious drinks!

This is for both the dining area as well as the bar. We did not check out the to go window

Pros:
Excellent drink selections - for beer/wine/mixed drinks
Great service
Delicious food

Cons:
Price, but it is located near the convention center, so what isn't pricey? Had a hard time paying $10 for a beer, even though it was delicious.

I went here for dinner with a group of 20 or so. Great selection of drinks. Food was also delicious. It was all served family style. There was only one item that I would probably not get again. Below is what we had.

- Marinated Ahi Tuna Cones - Unique and delicious!
- Grilled Kale Salad - Not our favorite. THis is the only item we wouldn't get again.
- Whole Petaluma Chicken - Wow! Awesome flavor.
- Wagyu Skirt Steak - Another winner. Just melts in your mouth.
- Whole Roasted Fish - Not sure what fish it was but it was tasty.
-Barbecued Carrots - Have had something like this before, but this would make me always eat my veges!
- Coal-Charred Corn - Another really tasty dish and its corn!
- Margarita Donut - Not the best donut I have had but it was unique. 

I went back for drinks on another evening. They have a fantastic selection of beers on tap. Ones you don't normally see, and especially not together. It was a little hard to pat $10 for a glass of beer, but the bartender was great as well as the atmosphere.

I wouldn't go back. The good part- the decor and vibe. The staff was ok, neither bad or good. 
The worse part- the food. Got the filet, meat ok, not tender like you expect for a filet. The flavors on the plate were overwhelming, almost seemed like an attempt to cover up the mediocre grade beef. Also got the ribs with cheese grits. Again meat not as tender, not awful, just mediocre. Over seasoned. And the cheese grits where more like a soup in the bottom of the pot it was served in. Mustard greens where blah. Got a side of mashed potatoes- they were inedible. So heavy handed with truffle oil it, it was a sin. Sent it back. The server didn't bat an eye, apologize or ask any questions- like it happens all the time. Waste of money and a meal.

Food was very good, and reasonable prices for The Strip. I especially liked the sausage and fennel flatbread. Service was attentive and the ambiance is fun. Drinks are overpriced and weak (which is typical for The Strip). I ordered the house margarita, which said it was made with fresh juice, agave nectar, and Patron. I think it actually contained alcohol, although it just tasted like cheap, sugary margarita mix, some people like that, but it's not for me.  My husband ordered a scotch and soda, which was mostly soda.  Will go back, but will skip the drinks and just order the food.

First meal in Vegas!! This place is very spacious and the food is very tasty. I came with a group of friends who all ordered different dishes and it seems like everyone enjoyed their meals. I got the truffle pizza and loved it.

Superb, incredible vibe in this restaurant!  I love sitting in the bar area in the front of the venue and people-watching down the MB's restaurant row while sipping on drinks.  Lots of fun!  I suggest the Scotch Olives and the Burger.

One of my two favorite restaurants in Las Vegas with a fun and creative menu!! 

I opted to sit at the chefs table since I was dining alone. Christopher, my fabulous waiter, had excellent food recommendations.

I started with the Marinated tuna cones that were artfully presented in a stand. The cone included whipped pink peppercorn creme fresh which created a little spicy zing.

I next had the Braised oxtail crostini. Toast dishes seem to be all the rage in Vegas right now and this dish did not disappoint. The oxtail was tensor and flavorful.

The final dish I tried was the Salt roasted beets. Sounds boring but it was not!! The beets were roasted in oranges, pistachio oil and goat cheese that made for a creamy and dreamy sauce that made me want to lick the plate. It was probably the best best dish I've ever had!

There were 5 sparking wines, white wines and red wines to choose from. My only complaint is that most were $19 a glass!!!

The restaurant is very open space wise and not ideal for a romantic dinner. Given the small plate nature of the dishes it's perfect for groups so that you can try lots of different things.

I'd highly recommend eating here and would definitely go back.

Few days ago had birthday dinner with the boys in Las Vegas @libertinesocial @mandalaybay new trendy American food eatery.  Food was great but the biggest issue is the slow service and lack detail in the service.  We had expected better considering the prices we were paying #flatironsteak #petalumachicken #friedchicken #seabass #corn #steak #mediumrare #delish #foodadventure #foodtour #foodies #foodie #foodporn #foodgasm #foodpicture #foodpics #foodpic #yummy #trendyrestaurant #yummyfood #lasvegas #mandalaybay #dinnerwithfriends #food

Wow, what a pleasant surprise... my coworkers and I planned a quick little dinner of 8 at Libertine on a Monday night. I don't think any of us were expecting such an incredible meal.

I had the skirt steak with cauliflower. The deal was cooked perfectly, it included a green Spanish sauce on the side that was refreshing. 

By far the best margarita I've had in Las Vegas, I highly recommend this great restaurant.

This restaurant has excellent food and great selections with only a few misses.  The small plates are not very small, and the entrees are regular size.  Do yourself a favor and don't over-order. 

There was a five minute wait without reservations on a Saturday night at around 7 pm. 

The small plates are remarkable.  I had the smoked ricotta gnudi, which were dumplings made with ricotta with semolina. The sauce had peas and mushrooms. They were topped with lamb prosciutto They were a new experience for me and they were sublime. 
 
I had some of the warm crab dip.  The crab had a lot of flavor. 

I also had the American Artisanal Cheeses, which came with grilled country bread, roasted grapes, almonds and a fruit preserves.  The cheeses were a triple cream Brie, Lincoln Log, which is a mild goat cheese, and a hard cheese whose name I didn't catch.  Delicious and recommended. 

For my main, I had the braised lamb shank pot pie.  I was pretty full at this point, but it was good.  The English peas were a highlight. 

Where mistakes were made were the side plates.  The grilled calcot onions were good, but the romesco was the star.  The sauce had hazelnuts, roasted red peppers, garlic, olive oil, and vinegar.  

Someone else ordered the Barbecued Carrots.  The one I had was burnt, chewy and stringy.  

The desserts looked really good, but I was stuffed.  
 

The prices are in-line for this type of restaurant.

Update:  The lunch counter Libertine to Go was an excellent value compared to almost everything  at the resort.  Order here for the pools and take it with you.

Unfortunately,not a good review.  Not sure if it was our waiter or the kitchen.  The waiter was not very attentive.  Waited an hour for a burger and a dinner salad, which the waiter did not observe. No more than an off handed apology, no offer to compensate for forgetting us. Since I was running late, we told the waiter we were on a time crunch and to please send the check.  The waiter didn't even notice when he brought the check that our food had not even been served and walked away.  We had to find him to ask for our food, which took 10 more minutes to come.  People who came 20 minutes after us, ate and left before we got our food.  Food was decent, not spectacular.

My husband and I visit Vegas quite frequently, and finally decided to try Libertine Social inside Mandalay Bay.  All I could think of was why did we wait so long to eat here?!  We arrived at 7:45 and were seated promptly in the main dining room.  We were then greeted by our server Andrew (I think) and he gave us the scoop on the specials for the night.  We ordered cocktails, and appetizers, and our dinners...everything was AWESOME!  Looking forward to dining at Libertine Social again and trying more items on the menu!

I was feeling super shitty and hungover, so I literally did not come out of my room until 3 pm one day and that was because we had show tickets and dinner plans.  We hadn't had lunch so we decided to stop in here and it was really good.

We ordered the cheese board and I got a glass of Prosecco for the hair of the dog.  The cheese was really good and the Prosseco helped get me going again.

Would definitely try this again if staying at Mandalay.

Small plates were superb - Flavorful and well cooked. Large plates were solid but not as good as small plates.

Nice and modern decor. Though kind of confusing what theme they're going for.

Food was definitely one of the best we've had in Vegas.
Get the spot by the grill if you want a little heat on you.  The food was phenomenal.

My bae and I recently stopped here for our 2 year anniversary dinner before hitting up the blue man show next door. I loved the open environment of the bar/lounge area, super chill and laid back vibe.

To start I had the Zig Zag cocktail which was a 5/5 for me. I loved the fresh watermelon and thought the balance of all the ingredients blended together deliciously for a very crispy, slightly sweet flavor. We then shared the spicy tuna cones (2/5) and warm crab dip (3/5). I loved the uniqueness of the cones, but they were just waaaay too salty for my liking. The crab dip was good and flavorful, but just missing that little extra something to make it a 5. The main course for us, the wagyu skirt steak, definitely a 5/5. The meat was so tender and seasoned perfectly. I couldn't get enough of the salsa verde. Absolutely amazing! The side of mashed Yukon gold potatoes were also a 5/5 for me. The texture was spot on and the truffle flavor was delicious and not too over powering. The portion size was also very generous too.

Overall I was very satisfied which the entree and side, but would most likely choose different small plates for next time.

Nice place to get a quick bite if you're at the Mandalay Bay Hotel or Conference Center. The restaurant is chic but has limited hours, so I got my food and beverages at the convenient Libertine to-go counter around the corner. 

I opted for the hot link, which was excellent. Not only was the link hot, but they add a wonderful house-made mustard which nicely complements the pork inside the sausage. 

I enjoyed this so much I ordered it twice during my current visit to the Sin City, washing it down with beer on one occasion, enjoying the stinging heat sans beer the next. 

Service is friendly and quick, décor is quirky and over the top, everything you'd expect in Las Vegas. 

Bon appétit.

The décor is very nice. The colors schemes are cool and comfortable, with just the right amount of light to attract your eyes to focal points and artwork. If you are seated at the bar, the bar is very nice to look at--back lit, nice woodwork and bottle display. There are televisions to watch, if you are so inclined. Looking out onto the general dining area, there are traditional dining tables, as well as (taller) pub tables with stools. They also have a lounge area with large stuffed chairs and sofas. I think knowing about the variety of seating arrangements is important if you want to consider choosing this venue. For example, if you are there for business and want to have a drink with colleagues, you might choose to sit in the lounge area, versus traditional tables. But as nice as the place looks, it does come down to the food and service.

As I was by myself, dining and drinking at the bar, mid-week, the service was good. I received the right balance of not too much, not too little attention.

My only disappointment was the dinner. I ordered the "Roasted Day Boat Scallops". I would say the presentation was good, and the plate appeared nice. The basic taste would have been good--except for the fact that there was the very light, beginning of an ammonia taste. (If you are unaware, an ammonia taste or smell is usually an indicator that the seafood has begun to spoil.)

My bill--dinner, two adult beverages and tip, was $77.00 (rounded up). So I wouldn't say that this venue was "cheap".

My boyfriend and I decided to have dinner here before the Michael Jackson show. Big disappointment overall. Whatever you do, don't sit in the section that has metal chairs for your "seating pleasure". These chairs are meant to quickly turnover patrons. I ordered the Farmer's Market Salad to start and when I say salty, I mean picked you lips salty! The salad was sent back and even the chef agreed! I ordered the chicken dish that was to come with brussel sprouts abs mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes was simply and drizzle on the plate. Tasty chicken but that's about it. All in all, $60 bucks with the tip.
Restaurant is eclectic and fun to look at. Food and service were okay. Not too busy at the time we went which makes me wonder what the hold up was.

This is a two-part review first time I visited the wait staff did a terrible job I spoke with the manager who asked me to come back the next day and I did. I had four guest with me we sampled five of the appetizers and all were exceptional in taste and quality. This is a great place for food and fun and I'll be returning the next time I come back to Vegas
Head Office and I had the Brussels and beet salads and they were exceptional and service was impeccable

Great food even better cocktail menu. Great ambience. Overall makes this LA girl feel at home. The Fizz drinks are amazing!!!! Great menu setup. Overall I want more of this in Vegas. 

Locals and tourists should come! Great service, fun cocktails and stand up food. 

My only criticism is the portions are too large - crazy I know, but I want to try more items and it's just my boyfriend and I. It's made for a party of 4. This place needs to think more Julian Serrano portion size, same price. 

They would be 5, ironically, with smaller portions lol. Never thought I'd say that.

Took a few colleagues and business associates here for a casual dinner after a conference. The guys are pretty laid back, so I didn't want to overwhelm them with a fancy meal. Libertine Social turned out to be the perfect spot to fit their vibe.

I requested a place that wouldn't be too loud and busy, so we were seated outside. I really like that we were outside, but I just wish our table was a tab bit larger. It felt a little cramped. Luckily, one guy didn't show up, so we were able to spread out a little bit.

My server was very helpful. He gave great suggestions and we were happy with everything that we chose. To start, we had spare ribs and the fennel & sausage flatbread. For meals, most of the guys ordered the 10 oz skirt steak. I ordered a salad because our starters were pretty heavy. Everything was exquisite. Nothing short of delicious.

We had a wonderful time here and the atmosphere allowed for great conversation. I would definitely go back to try something new and sit inside to enjoy the inside decor. Overall, I'm so happy with our experience!

Good, but I felt the menu a bit limited. More of a small plates type restaurant. Seemed more geared to cocktails then dining situation. Bathroom is horribly small. Waiting in the hallway for it to be free was awkward.

Sorry Libertine, this is so late! My husband and I went here last month and had a wonderful meal. We went before seeing the Michael Jackson One show and had not made a reservation, but there was room in the bar and we were seated immediately by a very nice hostess. (It's very noisy in the bar due to being so close to the walking path).
Helena was one of the sweetest, caring waitresses we've ever had; adorable. We told her the amount of time we had before the show and she made sure we were out in time.
Our food was good and we will go again when we are in the area. See photos for our meals.

Really good food here!  We made reservations here during a conference and the restaurant was packed, but it turned out to be the best meal at Mandalay Bay.  
We had a party of five and got a nice table.  The staff and service were superb.  
I ordered the WHOLE ROASTED BRANZINO
olive & caper vinaigrette, grilled lemon.  The fish was amazing! I enjoyed the meal with sides Asparagus - shaved country ham, poached farm egg, Avocado panzanella - toasted country bread, arugula, heirloom tomato, ricotta salata and dessert - MANHATTEN - whiskey bread pudding, maraschino, salted caramel ice cream.

I'll be sure to go back.

Never done this before but shout out to Libertine Social for their excellent staff. Been to LOTS of restaurants in Vegas and have never been treated so kindly. Greatly appreciate tonight! Friend was going through a harsh break up and they brought us drinks and cake on the house. Also, food was superb! Recommend the chicken and ribs.

From the moment I saw Libertine Social's sophisticatedly playful restaurant front beckoning to me from among the many choices along Mandalay Bay's restaurant row, I knew I had to try it. I am happy to report that the place is as fantastic as it looks.

All the dishes we tried were delicious. My favorite was the oysters on the half shell, which were served with a wonderfully flavorful mignonette. We also tried, and loved, the broccoli, the cauliflower, the beet salad, the spinach flatbread, and the prosciutto/cornbread board.

The only item I was disappointed with was the restaurant's signature cocktail--The Libertine Social. It just didn't work for me. I probably should have focused more on the ingredient list ("Will I really like Campari with limoncello, orange juice, and egg white?") before I ordered it.

The service throughout our meal was exemplary. We arrived slightly before 6 p.m. on Sunday night, and we let the hostess and the server know right away that we had tickets for the 7 p.m. Blue Man show at the Luxor. They not only ensured that we got our food very quickly, so that we actually had time to enjoy eating it, but they also let the manager know, and he stopped by to make sure that the service was meeting our time constraints. I was impressed and appreciative.

Two final notes: First, like almost every other restaurant on the Strip these days, Libertine Social's prices are high. The signature cocktail was $17. For two of us, each having one cocktail, sharing a half dozen oysters and one salad, two sides, one flat bread, and a board, the total bill, including tax, was $138. We were happily stuffed, but this is not bargain dining. Second, Libertine Social accepts MLife Express Comps, which is happy news for gamblers who like to eat well. The staff also knows that the restaurant accepts Express Comps, and the payment process was quick and easy (MLife players will know that this is not the case at every restaurant that accepts Express Comps).
Good bartenders, good food=goodtimes!!! great food and service! Got to try this place pho u r self!!!

Modern, hipster, gastropub that has a lively bar scene fronting the walkway from the convention center to the casino / hotel.  Great for people watching, relaxing after convention business or just getting away from the casino.  Rear of the restaurant is quieter with high 20 foot plus ceiling and conducive to business discussions or dining with the sig other.

Went for lunch, generally closed weekday for lunch unless there is a convention going on.  Had a medium rare skirt steak with chimmacharri sauce, grilled salmon which was perfectly cooked, and truffled mashed potatoes.  All were very good.

Service was excellent.  Place is a bit pricey, but hey, you're in Vegas where everything is pricey.

Self proclaimed "next generation gastropub".  Does it deliver?

- Replace the beer with a killer list of brown libations and seriously crafted cocktails.
- Replace the been there, done that, prettied up pub grub with in your face, up end, back yard BBQ.
- Toss in some rabbits in the decor (although there are none to eat on the menu).

In a word, yes.

Note:  This is social dining, order dishes in flights and share.

In general, flavors are very bold.  Sharp acidic contrast in flavors, spicy elements in dishes that will make you sweat, and underlying pleasant smoke throughout (hints of smoke permeate the restaurants so even if your dish doesn't have direct smoke flavor, you will still taste it).  Go for the bold.  You will be rewarded.

The octopus crostini exemplifies the style.  Loaded with tender slices of octopus, it is sat on a spicy, smoky roasted eggplant puree with bits of tart, pickled peppers and golden raisins.  Smack you in the face flavor that just works with any drink.

A "board" of wood grilled sausages packs a spicy punch, accented by grilled spicy peppers on a very acidic, tart, sauerkraut.  It sets your mouth on fire but the flavor of the individual sausages is impressive epically the merguez with its distinct lamb flavor and Northern African spice notes.

For larger plates, top props to the mesquite grilled whole branzino.  Blistered, charred skin adds a bitter component that makes the mildly sweet flesh of the fish come to life.  Flavors are boosted even further with a tangy olive and caper vinaigrette and slices of grilled lemon.  Very good.  

Steak lovers, it's all about the grilled wagyu skirt.  A great butchers cut, loaded with beefy flavor.  The smokiness brings out the sweetness.  A salsa verde enhances the natural metallic flavors of the beef.

Excellent cocktail program.  Well chosen list of craft cocktails backed up by a huge list of brown libations (there is a second high end bar in the back of the restaurant for those wanting to savor these treasures including the impossible to find Pappy's 20).  Typical resort markup.

Service is friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient.

I won't lie, I did go in expecting a mesquite grilled rabbit.  Alas.  I'll have to settle for these other flavorful dishes.

Very good food here!  Nicely designed interior, creates a very cool atmosphere that takes you away from the grand hallways of Mandalay Bay.  Excellent food, the roasted chicken/fried thigh dish was one of the best we've had.  Crab dip full of "real" big chunks of crab in a sublime white sauce and the panzenella salad had these garlic croutons that were amazing, and I don't usually eat croutons in salads.  Not to mention really good cocktails, made well, not overly sweet, nor too boozy, good balance.  Another great foodie stop in Vegas if you're at Mandalay Bay.

Libertine is a modern and hip gastropub. The decor is very visual with a lot of things to look at on the walls, cabinets as well as people watch if your in the lounge area in the front. Can get a little noisy if it's busy, but not so annoying. A nice, lively atmosphere if that's what you are looking for. Very roomy with lounge and dining areas.

They have a nice food and craft cocktails menu. Service was friendly and attentive. We asked our server some suggestions on what to get, and she was very knowledgable of the items she favored as well as some of the other items we were curious about.

A few items I enjoyed were:
Spicy Tuna Cones
Black Truffle Pizza
Lamb Skewer
Margarita Donuts 

Overall a great dining experience, would come back as well as recommend to anyone looking for something new to try.

This was our first stop after landing in Vegas. The menu wasn't outwardly vegan friendly, but a manager or something or other who was with the hostess was crazy accommodating, knowledgable, and had suggestions for us. We went with the shishito pepper flatbread without cheese and hummus plate -- dude. 

The flatbread was pretty good -- the peppers were a little spicy, the bread had a nice chew to it, and it was a decent size. But, something about the hummus was ridiculous. First, best hummus I've ever had, easily. Second, the cauliflower they have with it is quick pickled and delicious. Lastly, the pita bread they use is lightly seasoned and grilled and insanely tasty. I never thought something as simple as a hummus plate could be so phenomenal, but here we are. 

Libertine Social's menu in itself doesn't lend a lot of vegan options, but they seem more than willing to figure things out for you. Options are limited, but certainly excellent. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

Stopped in for a drink and a meal and so glad I did. Had the barrel-aged Manhattan after a great discussion with the bartender, who was knowledgeable and creative. The Porchetta was excellent. It's crowded, pricy and strict on seating but was a fun reprieve from a busy conference. Definitely not your touristy Vegas spot -- give it a try.

Cute hipster place with a fun vibe. The service was good and manager even came by to check on how things were going.

I got the sausage platter, broccoli side and veal cavetelli to share. The broccoli was awesome and my fav of all the food.

While staying at Mandalay Bay myself and two friends tried out the new Gastropub, Libertine Social for the first time. I had been wanting to experience this small plate eatery since learning that it was helmed by Sage chef Shawn McClain. Sage is famous for its farm to table, locally sourced menu. Sage is in my top five Las Vegas restaurants, so a visit to L.S. was a must do. The emphasis here is what I would call Sage Light with many menu items coming from the bright and shiny wood fired grill (the aroma was amazing). We started off with Feta and lamb stuffed Scotch Olives, 24 hour braised Porchetta, and Fois Gras Mousse with berry mostada and country toast. All were exceptional. Two of us had 8 oz. filet mignon cooked on the mesquite wood fired grill with roasted Maitake mushrooms and Béarnaise. The steaks were as good as any I've had in Las Vegas and perfectly cooked! My other friend had the seared Day Boat Scallops with  roasted peach purée, Lardo, and Calabrian Chili Vinaigrette. They were delicious but a lot spicer than expected in a good way. Delicious! The side vegetable was the dish we couldn't stop talking about. Wood grilled broccoli with Taleggio cream, wow! Too much food to order dessert, and the bill came to $211 plus tax. The cocktail program is by Tony Abou-Ganim who designed Bellagio's original bar menu's and many others around town. The drinks looked spectacular. We did not partake as we had had plenty the night before.

Was in Vegas for a girls trip, we were staying in Vegas and wanted something relatively easy to get to and not super scene-y or expensive. Libertine hit the mark perfectly. We popped down around 7pm on a Saturday without any reservations and were able to get a seat in their lounge area, which overlooks the interior of the hotel walkway (great people watching). (Note: We were here only a week or so after it opened so I assume it will get busier).

I can't get over the décor here, I loved everything about it. Very "now"...with a mix of art installations (make sure to look up if at the bar), mixed metals and natural wood elements. The food is geared more towards appetizers and small bites for sharing versus personal larger entrees. They have a mix of cocktails as well, they even do something where the mix and pre-bottle some cocktails. I tried one...it was interesting, it didn't seem as fresh to me but I honestly can't tell you if that was more of a mental thing. 

If you are looking for a place to grab some small bites and cocktails before a night out, definitely stop in.

Impressed by Shawn McClain since his Green Zebra days back in Chicago, a meal at Sage shortly after it opened confirming that his elegant simplicity could indeed translate to the Las Vegas market
(though Five-50 Pizza later proved to be a half-baked Money Grab,) rumors of Libertine Social at Mandalay Bay being the first Casino restaurant in ages to challenge Gastro-Pub conformity by way of ingredients and technique finally lured me in almost exactly six months after it's opening August 8th
2016 opening.

Not immune to the advertising or PR push, an invite to the grand-opening by Kerry Clasby politely declined as 2016 was dedicated to supporting more longstanding restaurants both on the Strip and in the community, it was as a party of two that dinner on Friday was enjoyed amidst spacious confines where guests are invited to sit at the bar, lounge or dining room in back, a plethora of decorations ranging from street signs to old-LPs decorating the walls as music plays forgivingly lightly.

Certainly a spectacle, the outdoor patio and well-stocked bar both showcasing design as low lighting generates an intimate feel despite the restaurant's size, the menu and kitchen at Libertine Social are the responsibility of Executive Chef Jamaal Taherzadeh, his modern American cuisine ranging from fun to seriously technique-oriented while vegetables from the Intuitive Forager Farmers Markets stand unparalleled on their own, or when used to enhance the flavor of everything from Pastas and Flatbreads to roasted Meats.

Well celebrated for Cocktails crafted by Tony Abou-Ganim, the classics perhaps a bit pricey given their nearby ubiquity while the Fizzes, Draught, Barrel-Aged and Bottled lists all show a lot of thought, those fond of Gin are encouraged to take a look at the refreshing Apple Cobbler with a clean Cucumber finish while Vodka fans will undoubtedly be delighted by a frothy Milano that is Spirit-forward and bright with a whole lot of Citrus.

Partially deferring to Chef Taherzadeh and adding a few intriguing items along the way, guests enjoying a drink would be foolish to ignore the Scotch Olives pitted and packed with Cheese beneath a lightly fried Lamb Sausage Crust, the laser-cut Modern Fried Egg a vessel seen several times in the past but here better than most with creamy Corn Pudding blanketed in Egg Custard beneath a dollop of Caviar.

Taking the extra steps to pour a chilled Watercress Soup tableside over King Crab Salad before having some fun with airy, flavor-packed Churros that will make fans of Cheetos question why they've been fooled into thinking the snack was as good as it gets for so long, a different sort of upgrade is delivered by 'Shrimp n' Grits' that improves on both with snappy Prawns and creamy Polenta plus the savory heat of Chorizo.

Turning attention to some Boards, Spreads and Dips, the Pretzels puffy and piping hot alongside house Mustard and melted Raclette, more Crab comes by way of the creamed Spinach Dip studded with big chunks of the good stuff flown in daily from Alaska while the Duck Liver Mousse at first appears to be far too much for even a party of four until the air is stirred out of it and the bright Fig-Balsamic Glaze on top turns it into the city's most luxurious PB&J-reminiscent topping for Grilled Bread.

Placing two handmade Pastas on the menu, one old and the other new, Jamaal admits that the tender Lamb Neck served over Cavatelli is his dish most often taken home for dinner, the salting intense even when accounting for the mellowing effect of Ricotta while the Sweet Potato Agnolotti rival any Italian restaurant in town by placing the typical Sage and Brown Butter in a different context with softened Pears and toasty brown Pesto.

Mistakenly guessing the sweet and savory duet of Honey-drizzled Fennel and Sausage Flatbread plus Barbecued Carrots atop earthy Kohlrabi Puree as the final round before dessert, and thus overindulging in both as they each exemplify the pure, honest flavors familiar to followers of Chef McClain, it was with wide eyes that the kitchen presented two more entrée-sized plates including Sea Bass quite similar to that at Aureole next door (minus the head) plus a daily special of Medium-Rare Wagyu brightened by acid with a bit of heat and Black Truffles plus an outstanding side of "Local Fare" featuring wrinkly Fingerling happily soaking up the flavors of two types of Pork carried by a soft-poached Egg. 

Taking a Double Espresso over Ice next, the choice of Cubes vs. Pellets a nice touch, dessert was presented with two menu-favorites plus the all-new Black and Tan Pudding, a refreshing savory note imparted by the Cream in a tall glass while neither the Pie nor Bread Pudding were overly sweet, instead focusing on letting the ingredients shine on their own with the Maraschino Cherry Ice Cream playing particularly well off the Whiskey in replicating the classic flavors of a Manhattan Cocktail.
Really, really good if you like good food. If you don't like tasty food, then this is definitely not your place.

The food is fantastic. We started with the grilled large shrimp with polenta: absolutely delicious! The beet salad with pistachio oil hit the spot: best best salad I have eaten until now and I have eaten many beet salad!  I had the branzino as my main meal: incredibly good and grilled to perfection. The cauliflower side order was just ok. I am not sure that that I would order that again. 
The Pinot Noir bottle of wine was lovely as a 2014 Russian River Valley choice: it was outstanding.
We were too full for dessert, yet I found choices to be ok.
Ambiance is nice, restaurant is open and relaxed. 
Service is ok... a little slow, yet very friendly. 
I would go back. Great for groups and friends. So so for families with small children.
Prices are moderate and fair. Realistically $60 to $100 per person w/o alcohol if looking for full dinner.

Came here before a Billy Idol show. Enjoyed the food and service. I would come back here. Only comical thing was there were little flies all around our table (I swear we showered) that wouldn't leave. They were especially drawn to the wine, so I asked the waiter for a coaster to cover the top of the wine glass.

Came here because I love a good gastropub and as a foodie, the menu looked amazing. Went balls to the wall and got the ahi tuna cones, prosciutto/cornbread platter, shaved brussel sprouts salad, and grilled gulf shrimp.

Hands down the gulf shrimp and prosciutto flatbread were some of the best food I've eaten in a while. Gulf shrimp came with this amazing polenta, and the prosciutto flatbread came with delicious cornbread and honey butter - so delicious. The shaved brussel sprouts salad was also amazing with thick bacon, and the ahi tuna cones were spicy and refreshing.

Had three glasses of wine which were great, and split a Cable Car (a little sweet but I'm not a big cocktail person). Loved it all.

Besides that, loved the atmosphere and our servers and bussers were amazing and super friendly.

Fish of the day was a variety of cod with a very fancy name. Very well executed though. Crispy tissue thin skin and a light but flavorful
Sauce. One selection was extensive, both the roses I tried were delicious. Attentive and professional staff. Nice atmosphere too. Definitely my favorite spot at the Mandalay this visit.
Food was tasty but we were a tad disappointed that the pretzel & fondue were not available and they were also out of a couple of beer selections but service was very good and timely!

Libertine is definitely a trendy restaurant with the casual fare at upscale prices - way upscale prices.  The food is overpriced for what it is - even by Vegas standards.  Neither the restaurant, atmosphere, the level of service or the food are worth the prices they charge.  
The highly-recommended short ribs, which was our waiter's "favorite dish", were bland and dry (at $48).    The Libertine Burger was just a smashed bun surrounding a burger and grilled onions - nothing else to it, no sauce, no flavor, nothing (at $28).  And the Roasted Petaluma Chicken came partly fried.  Right next to a very delicious roasted breast of chicken were three sprigs of overcooked broccoli and a pile of charred bits of fried mess.  The fried mess was apparently the rest of the chicken, a thigh hacked into pieces, battered and burned to a crisp in a deep fryer.  At first, I wasn't even sure it was part of the meal or some kind of weird garnish.  As I began chipping away at the chunks of charcoal, I found the greasy bits of chicken hiding in the pile.  
The service was good, although that is mostly from all the other staff as we only saw our waiter to order, confirm food delivery and pay the check.  
The best part about the whole experience was the dessert we had: dark chocolate and caramel bread pudding topped with a salted caramel and chocolate-chip ice cream.  It was heavenly, divine and provided gratis for my partner's birthday.  
On the whole, we had an enjoyable dining experience but I wouldn't recommend the restaurant to anyone who asked and I wouldn't return there unless someone invited us to join them.

Food was delicious. We had reservations for when the restaurant first opened so the food came out super fast and the restaurant was calm. Our waiter wasn't too nice but other staff at the restaurant were kind to us.

We hosted a client event at Libertine which was great. They reserved two couch areas for our group, we had pre ordered apps and had a beer/wine bar. The only thing that seemed a bit out of the ordinary was their prices. Other than that the small bites we had were great and flavorful. We had the ahi Tuna cones, sausage flatbread, shrimp cocktail, Margherita flatbread,and a few more. Overall food was decent and our waitress was very attentive too

Libertine Social is a solid restaurant from Shawn McClain.  We attended before a concert at Mandalay Bay and it was a good choice.  

Make a reservation and be sure they honor it... In general I recommend Open Table reservations for all restaurants in Vegas because it's so easy to use and get (and never worth waiting when there are so many restaurant options in town).  Be careful that they honor your reservation, when we attended they attempted to put us at a bar.  The hostess seating us (different from the one that greeted us) let us know that their dining room was fully committed and that the bar was all they had.  We know it was committed, we had a reservation, right?  When we highlighted this, we were fairly quickly given a table but certainly not at the greeting hostess' delight.

What really matters, the food:  The burger was very good, just be prepared for a two patty burger that is very filling.  The Lobster Ravioli was one of the best I've seen in Vegas.  Expensive but made up for it with lots of lobster.  The filling was primarily lobster and corn.  The "Black and Tan" pudding was dark chocolate and butterscotch.  The butterscotch was amazing, the dark chocolate just okay.  Overall a worthy visit.

Ordered:
Off the Menu Burger
Lobster Ravioli
"Black and Tan" Pudding

Overall: Good choice before a event at Mandalay Bay

This place is in the Mandalay Bay. It is a nice, hip atmosphere and the bartender, Jose, was super friendly and made tasty drinks. We didn't eat the food this time (minus a star), but it's definitely a nice place to go if you're in the hotel. It also isn't open that late and doesn't play good music (minus another star). There are some fun dare cards, if there were actually equally fun patrons in the place doing them, but there are none that I saw! Disappointing stiffs! The partner/owner of the bar actually came up to me and said "try this drink" and wanted my opinion on it, so I got a free cocktail which is always nice. I will be back next time to try some food too. For now, only pics of the drinks and atmosphere.

Literally the best meal I had in Vegas... and it was to go. They're fried chicken sandwich and fried is so good. They need to stock they're coffee more cause it was a three day conference and they ran out every day before I could get there at 11 am

We had a reservation and when we showed up our table was not ready and we had to wait for 20 minutes. When ordering cocktails they were out of most things so I had to settle for a more expensive drink. The bottled cocktails are very good. As far as food goes they are overpriced. One drink, 6 oysters, and the fried chicken came out to a $92 bill. I ordered the oysters only to realize the restaurant does not have saltines. The wait staff was very nice, helpful, and the atmosphere is neat as well. The fried chicken and brussel sprouts were delicious despite being overpriced.

2 stars for the service from our waitress(s) and the aloof male host who completely ignored us while we waited to be seated. 4 stars for the food and the gentleman who asked us how we enjoyed everything at the end of our meal. 

My co-habby and I made the long trek up to Vegas to see Janet Jackson and show our support to the fallen and Vegas residents from the devastating shootings that took place 2 weeks prior. Our hearts, thoughts and prayers go out to all of those affected.

Although I loved the decor and ambience of Libertine Social, I was not impressed by our server that day. While she was friendly at the beginning, she seemed perturbed that we didn't immediately order alcohol with our food. We were still undecided on what we wanted to drink and instead of asking if we wanted more food/beverages, she proceeded to swipe our menu and give it to someone else; didn't even ask if she we needed anything else, just assumed we were done. And there was a menu at an empty table across from us too!! So much for the extra food, cocktail order and my hubby's beer we wanted! We were also expecting another guest and then another waitress decides to take our extra seat WITHOUT even asking us. RUDE MUCH? The only reason why I think our waitress started being nice after was because I was staring daggers at her.

The only saving grace was the gentleman who checked in on us and the Parmesan Churros which were to die for and melt in your mouth amazing. The flatbread was not bad either. Very happy with our food but very UNHAPPY with the service from our waitress...wish we had gone to the Sushi place across the way like we had originally planned. Lesson learned. Good food but terrible service.

I was in Vegas for work and took a coworker here since I happened to know someone who works here (thanks Mike) and it was amazing. Tried several appetizers and entrees- my favorites are the scallops and the ribs. Presentation was on point and the flavors danced on my tongue. Will be back!

Libertine Social is a great place to grab a few appetizers before a show. We walked in (no wait) on a Friday evening around 5:30pm for drinks and appetizers before a show. It was very quiet, and we were seated away from everyone else. The atmosphere is very hip, with new and interesting drinks and dishes to choose from.

Between the four of us, we shared the following plates: House Baked Pretzel, Shaved American Prosciutto, Spare Ribs, and Grilled Gulf Shrimp. The consensus favorite was the house baked pretzel with the cheese fondue - I could have ordered a few of those and been satisfied. The ribs and shrimp were cooked really well. The prosciutto with melons was pretty standard. 

Overall, if you find yourself at this end of the strip or at Mandalay specifically, you should check out Libertine social. Great atmosphere and delicious food.

Poor service (server was understaffed or too busy to take care of us but he was very nice nonetheless) but the food is AMAZING! The crab dip was to die for (note: ask for side of lemon and pepper to intensify taste buds) truffle pizza amazing and tuna cones were great! Would be 5 stars if our server was a little attentive. Every time we had a question he would walk away midsentence. This place has lots of potential!

Great gastropub in Vegas--nice to people watch while eating from the lounge seats.  Shared a wonderful foie gras mousse and the flavorful chicken with Brussel sprouts. Great service and theme. Prices are reasonable for the high quality and inventive food as long as you don't go crazy with drinks.
Had a couple of drinks at the bar and Sean the bartender was amazing! Knowledgeable and very friendly!

Our server Dutchy was amazing, the atmosphere was amazing and the food was out of this world.  The gnocchi was simply suburb as was the pizza with truffles.  Only bad thing is we found it on our last day in Vegas.  Thanks for wrapping up our trip in style!!

It's always so hard to decide where to eat in Vegas. But Libertine is definitely a can't  miss restaurant!   The service and food was incredible!!!   My boyfriend has the fish ... beautifully prepared and was amazing.   I had the filet and it was undeniably the best filet I have ever experienced!

We have been her two times and both experiences were AMAZING! 

Our First was days after October 1, and we wanted to give back to the local servers at Mandalay Bay. But since we had such an amazing time we brought our friends back for a double date..

The food is unique, fresh and something you will remember.. their hand crafted drinks are strong but very palatable, two rounds each and damn we were having a great time!

Our friend Kerry Clasby, the "Intuitive Forager"(http://www.intuitiveforager.com/) who provides many of the best dining establishments in the US with their produce (some fly in what she provides daily) has been recommending Libertine Social since it opened. I see why. My wife and I sat at the bar in front of the kitchen. So we not only had a fantastic meal where every single thing we ordered was fantastic, we also got to enjoy watching the chefs at work. What a joy. We have been back a few times and can not wait to return. I apologize
for not having our menu items to reference, it took me too long to write this.

I highly recommend the chicken entrée which was one of the most flavorful I've had in years. I echo the comments of most of the other reviewers regarding the ambience and atmosphere. The service was very prompt and attentive and I could actually watch game seven of the World Series in a fun yet relaxing atmosphere.
First time for a Corporate dinner. Food was really good and they managed to serve a couple of 100 folks on time and efficiently. A must stop next time you're in Vegas.

Libertine Social is a great addition to the Mandalay Bay campus. After eating at the usual spots for few years while we attended annual conferences, we really needed a new place and Libertine Social offered that fresh vibe under the gastro pub identity but it's much more than that. 

It's an open concept restaurant with a lounge and a bar (they have their own 'Fireside Chat' menu) in the front and the dining room is in the back. While we were there for dinner they had a basketball game on in the lounge area so it's a very relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. They are not greedy with space as they have comfy leather couches and arm chairs to relax with a drink.

Menu is all about shareable plates and the dishes from the mesquite-fired wood burning grill in the open kitchen. One of the most memorable and tastiest dishes was the Whole Roasted Branzino from the grill which was cooked to perfection. It can be easily shared between two people. If you are not in to seafood then go for the 10oz Wagyu or the bone-in ribeye, they are equally delicious. Some of the other notable dishes were the roasted chicken, seared scallops and the burger. Our group is not much in to salads or desserts but these got the favorite vote: Avocado Panzanella, Roasted Beets, Strawberry Rhubarb Crumble and the Margarita Donuts. 

Considering that we always ate at the Red Square, Aureole, RM Seafood and Lupo during a seven day conference,  this trip we ate at the Libertine Social on three separate occasions. One drawback was the unresponsive host station and somewhat slow service but I'll give them a break due to the few large parties eating at the same time as we were there including a very large party in the private room.

We hope to return next year, let's hope they'll stay as good as when we were there.

Enjoy!

Came here during the soft opening, and I was very impressed. We ordered a little of everything...ahi tuna cones were delicious. Skirt steak, two thumbs up. The kale salad...so good. Avocado salad, yum! The modern egg was so good and something I would never typically order, but I'm glad that I did! Desserts were great, drink inspired. 
And of course, the drinks were on point. They bottle a few drinks so that was a nice personalization. 
If you're in the area this is a great spot to grab a drink and bite or have a culinary experience. 
The decor and atmosphere is fun, so definitely a great place to go with a group of friends.

What a great choice. We stumbled on in for a few appetizers and craft beer. We ended up getting the Braised Lamb with a Pomegranate sauce. Wow. Also the sweet potato Angoloti with a sage and olive oil sauce was bomb. Our server Alicia was very helpful in our beverage and food choices and always checked up shortly after every item arrived for complete guest service. A shot of espresso and house made limoncello went great with the bread pudding topped with maraschino ice cream. It was a nice little pit stop and I will definitely hit it up again when I go back to Vegas.
